Reviews.Title: “Good location, loved amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: ellejay22
Reviews.Content: Nice central hotel, really good location 10min walk to Anne Frank house and the red light district. Central station is only a few minutes walk away just behind Dam square. We booked a twin room for 2 nights, first night we were told there were no twin rooms available so had to stay in a cramped double room, 2nd night we were moved to a really big spacious clean twin room. The staff were all really friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was just standard buffett breakfast. Overall a nice, clean, friendly hotel, really good value for money. Best way to get around amsterdam is on the hop on hop off canal boats, buy the tickets all round central station, really good as they travel past all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Irati A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: everything was ok. The location is perfect, 8 minutes to the Bloemen market, 3 minutes to Dam square.. And Teresa was really friendly with us. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “It's a pure *** star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo R
Reviews.Content: Expensive for what you get. Very simple and small rooms, small twin beds with hard & tall pillows. Nice view (canal) if your room is the entrance side. Very quiet and close to Dam Square and walking distance to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cbuzza
Reviews.Content: We booked the rembrandt hotel for the weekend 24 march till 26 2012 after reading tripadviser, we arrived at 9.0 oclock and we were able to book in straight away which we found very good as it gave us the full day. The room number was 323 it was a twin room and we found it very big and comfortable, with bath and shower. the bathroom was big and clean we were on the third floor with a view overlooking the canal. my brother in law and his wife had booked a double room which we found small room 322 good view. the hotel is in a perfect location and adequate for our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, clean room, good value”
Reviews.Author: Walker036
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rembrandt classic hotel from 23 - 26 March 2012. Our twin room was fairly small but as we planned to be out for most of the day, more than adequate for us. No great view, but again, that didn't really matter. The beds were clean and comfortable. The pillows were a bit on the small side, but OK. Bathroom was clean and had shower over the bath. Plenty of hot water and good quality complimentary toiletries provided. Buffet style breakfast was good. Plenty of choice and always some hot choices as well as the usual croissants, pastries, cakes, fresh fruit and cereals. There were always scrambled eggs and the hotel seemed to alternate between very well cooked smoked bacon and small sausages, The quality of the coffee at breakfast was rather poor, however. We found the staff to be extremely helpful, providing us with city maps and writing on them so we would recognise landmarks - this was really good as Amsterdam is easy to get lost in. The staff struck a good balance between politeness and friendliness and invited us to ask them if we had any queries. This hotel is away from the main tourist squares, which is actually a good thing as this means it is quiet in the evenings, while still being only a few minutes' walk from decent bars, cafes, restaurants and coffee shops. The hotel came at a great price and I will definitely stay there again if visiting Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Matmorfus
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel but nothing over the ordinary. Average rooms (though spacious) and average service. The location is perfect, and that is a great plus. But if you're looking for a treat, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful and Central”
Reviews.Author: OMGJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of work colleagues in Rembrandt last weekend. For 53 Euros we each had a single room without breakfast. The rooms were very clean and the service was excellent. The hotel's excellent location makes it ideal for a weekend break in Amsterdam. It is close to Dam Square, Anne Frank Museum and the shopping area. The furniture and carpets are rather dated but the location and staff service more than make up for this. This is a three star hotel but staff go that extra mile. Reception staff provided a map and showed us how to get to places of interest. This hotel provides a cheap and cheerful base for a weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Near to everything”
Reviews.Author: JeffCST
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in end February to early March. After reading that rooms in Amsterdam is really small, am surprise to find the room to be spacious. Staff is ok, not too friendly but would help if you ask. Breakfast is good!! would recommend having breakfast before heading out for the day. The negative side is the banging of doors and the carpet need to be cleaner if not change. Key to the room does not work very well, would need to give it a few tries before it open. The toilet is acceptable, clean and functional. Love the location, its so central that everything is not more than 15min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good”
Reviews.Author: 40Julie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November and I have to say room was spacious ,large comfy double bed loved it.Sadly stayed again this march room was tiny( second floor) single hard beds pushed together to make double,doors banging early hours (practically non stop really) and staff not too pleasant except waiter at breakfast!! Also my partner and I have flea bites over our body( can't say it was beds but who knows) if you can stay on top floor 400 and up I think you'll be ok other rooms on other floors are tiny your knocking into each other constantly.I hope this helps I've never moaned about a hotel before but just don't want people to have an uncomfortable stay after saving money for a nice break

Reviews.Title: “absolute discrace”
Reviews.Author: alex w
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends on a business trip and the key to our room didnt work till after 6 attemps of the manager making new ones. it took 2 hours to get this sorted making us late for the important meeting we had and the deal fell through costing us a fortune. Next morning, the shower came alive and flew of the wall like a firemans hose, scallding each of us and having finally sorting this dangerous problem, we arrived 10 minutes late for breakfast and staff wouldnt serve us. staff then kept us waiting half an hour to check out with no real apoligy for our inconvieniences.staff very laid back and unintrested. All in all a big dissapointment. Scallding cobra shower very dangerous.BE WARNED

Reviews.Title: “Good staying for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_Marinho
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, great beds. No breakfest and a little far from the tour points.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that is not enough..”
Reviews.Author: TheFunkyDuck
Reviews.Content: We have been here for 3 nights for a short trip to Amsterdam, we have been here a few times and I've found the Rembrandt Classic to be disappointing. The location is great, but that can be said of all central Amsterdam hotels. The City is quite small and almost everything is a short walk away from wherever you are. The breakfast is nice with lots to choose from, and the rooms are a good size and clean. There are lots of English (BBC1 & ITV) French and German channels on the TV. Unfortunately the cons outweigh the pros. The hotel is generally quite shabby and very dated, certainly not a 'classic' look, more a 'we have forgotten to renovate for 30 years' look. The furniture in the dining room and communal areas are dark and depressing. Some windows are cracked and the courtyard rear of the property is quite unkempt and unpleasant if your room overlooks it (ours did). It is a great size hotel, and it could be lovely, sadly it isn't. I think the hotel is popular with the stag party crowd as in the evening there was a lot of rowdy noise that was very distracting. Generally there is quite a lot of noise from other customers. Staff are friendly enough, however when we checked in, a customer was being dealt with as there was a mix up with their reservation. I can only say the person (who I think was a manager) seemed quite off with them and quite rude. All this while there is an increasing queue of people waiting to check in and watching the whole drama. It could have been dealt with much much better. They advertise there being free Wifi, this is partly true. There is very slow basic wifi available, however the hotel must subscribe to a certain amount of free wifi as by early evening the free facility goes down and you are prompted to purchase faster wifi. This happened every night, and then you have to wait until 9am the next morning to get the free wifi again. The price of this hotel may be what attracts many people, however Amsterdam is saturated with good low cost hotels, if you shop around you can get much better value for money, much better surroundings, much better quality and much better service than the Rembrandt Classic.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: tgendorf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. While the furniture in public areas and in the rooms is a little outdated it is still a descent 3 star hotel if you visit Amsterdam. Upon check-in we were asked to pay an additional city tax (which is common) and a cash deposit for further expenses. As we did not use any extras at the hotel, this was refunded promptly in cash. The hotel is located on a quite road, right by a typical canal. The dam square is about 5 min walk away. All main attractions like the Anne Frank house, Red light district etc are close by and within walking distance. The train station "centraal" is about 25 min walk, so I would recommend a taxi when you have some luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the photos online!”
Reviews.Author: GaelicKaz
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for my friend to stay in as our apartment is close by. Rembrandt classic, on the herengracht, centrally located, should be great. Nice outside exterior. Unfortunately that is where it ended. As the price was very low and the pictures were so good, we should have been suspect, but anyway. The room was clean enough, but old design, not comfortable beds, just enough to survive, and it wasnt' going to be used very much, just to lay the heads for one night. If you are needing a cheap last minute, this place can go for under 50euro in a good location, so if you are needing something without the thrills and fancy wrapping, it would be ok.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: Scott Q Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was grand, was about 5min walk into the shopping and food area. the room was clean as from what i could see, not much in it though but fine for if you don't spend much time in the room. The sleep quality for me and my partner wasn't that great as the beds where a bit hard for us as the pillows where really uncomfee

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: ManjinderSD
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to pop over to Amsterdam for the weekend in Jan and found this hotel on hotels.com. Got it for a decent price. It is centrally located close to a lot of tourist destinations. The stay was decent...you get what you pay for. The hotel is a bit dated which is expected for Amsterdam. The room was somewhat clean but looked tired. We had two single beds and sheets on one of them had stains on it but those were changed. The washroom also looked dated...the shower curtain was too small for the tub so the water always managed to get on to the floor. The toilet was ready to break into pieces if you tried to use it. Overall it was mediocre nothing amazing, nothing terrible. I would recommend the hotel to others only if you want something to sleep at, nothing amazing. If I were to go back I'd probably try another hotel just because this one seemed very depressing. Our room was on the first floor. Try to get something higher up because you have a lot of people walking by late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Just back”
Reviews.Author: Belcat1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great weekend in Amsterdam. Read the reviews before we went and have got to say most of them were spot on! Took other reviewers advice and asked for a room on the third floor. Was a really helpful receptionist on duty and she gave us room 309 Thank you Christina! It was great. Very warm - it was minus 10 outside- beds were very clean and the most comfortable I have slept in. It also had a lovely canal view and a very clean, modern bathroom. Also tried the breakfast it was great. Yes it is an old hotel and could do with a face-lift but it was excellent value for money and very central.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: boyblue69
Reviews.Content: My partner and I normally do a couple of mini cruises to Holland in the winter using P & O Ferries from Hull to Europoort & then onto Amsterdam for the day before reurning to the ship in the evening. This time we decided to stay over for an extra night to sample the night life & I couldn't have picked a better hotel for its location, comfort and service. We checked in on Friday 20 January 2012 one & a half hours before we were due to and there was no quibble from the friendly receptionist. Room G25 was fatastically spacious with a walk in wardrobe and very modern en suite with a king size divan that could have slept 4. The main room itself was airy with a high ceiling beautifully plastered & painted,which gave the appearance of a drawing room. This room was at the rear of the hotel, which afforded us peace & quiet, though being canal-side I can't imagine anyone having problems at the front either. The hotel has been given 3* status,which is well deserved. I booked the room for 71 Euros for the night and enjoyed a very tasty and varied breakfast for 8.50 Euros the morning after. The staff are courteous and efficient and the hospitality second to none. I would recommend this establishment to anyone & hope to do a return visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit of a shabby hotel though”
Reviews.Author: thetastingnote
Reviews.Content: If you need a clean bed for the night in the centre of Amsterdam and get a package deal, this is the ideal hotel for you. If you want anything more than that, I'd give this hotel a miss. It is situated perfectly in the centre of town, close to everything that you would want to go to (and that includes the shadier parts!), but the whole hotel is tired. Our room had badly plastered repairs to holes in the wall, a broken shower head that not only directed water at your feet, but didn't shut off the bath tap so you ended up taking a shower and ending up standing in a bath full of water. It would also be great if there was a room with a few sofas so you could sit down and relax rather than having to just go back to your room. Having said all this, the bed was clean, the staff friendly and helpful and we got a really good deal. Stay at this hotel for the location in the city, but if you want anything else, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us!”
Reviews.Author: Abigail W
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night - November 18, 2011. I was a bit nervous after booking this hotel for my boyfriend and I, because of some mixed reviews on this site, but after we arrived, I realized I'd made the right decision. It was one of few hotels that allowed only one night's stay. I booked the room for only 74 euros. 10-15 minute walk to Amsterdam Centraal Station. In the middle of the negen straatjes! Great shopping area. The room was a good size, not huge, but bigger than we needed. The hallways definitely smelled like marijuana, but to be honest, it didn't bother either of us. It's to be expected in the city. Our room was non-smoking and there was no smell inside. Linens were crisp and clean. The bathroom was nice, and a few toiletries were provided. There was a TV (although we never turned it on). And best of all, when we got into our room, we opened a window/door to discover that we had a small balcony! After we walked onto it, we realized that we were lucky enough to get the only balcony in the hotel, and as far as we could tell, the only one on the street. They safely stored our bags after we checked out the next day, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “good compromise”
Reviews.Author: KhalidTravel
Reviews.Content: good location ,2 blocks from dam square +shopping streets & nice view from your room if you get canal view ; very good place to stay if you want to soak up the amsterdam atmosphere though comfort was minimal but it's a good compromise given the rate ;

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: nazPaisley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for long wkend had a lovely time. location was central to everywhere. most tourist attractions were within walking distance. hotel clean, modern staff were lovely. would defanately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent accomodations, mediocre at best, but OK”
Reviews.Author: struct84
Reviews.Content: The Rembrandt Classic Hotel was an interesting choice. When I checked in 3 employees were at the desk while 6 customers waited to check in/check out. One of them disappeared to the back room, one decided it was time to check and fill all the staplers. So after about 40 minutes, I got checked in. The room was very small, (about 1/3 of the size of most cheap chains in America) The windows were old and there was a constant breeze coming in and even with the heat cranked up, it was cold. They brought up a space heater which did the trick. The staff are very friendly. The breakfast was pretty reasonable at 8.50Euros. When the employee brought up the space heater and came to check the room out, he just used his key and came on in (even with the Do Not Disturb on the door) he never knocked or anything. I thought it was very rude and disrespectful to a guest to not at least knock first. Once you learn the hotel location, everything is a 10 minute walk, so no need to ride the trams. Even though the room was small it was clean and comfortable, and the bed was even a good night's rest. Overall I would recommend Rembrandt Classic Hotel, just don't expect American type service from the employees and don't be afraid to ask for an extra heater. (Ice is also available, but it takes about 10 minutes for an employee to get it for you.) oh, by the way, the room doors slam shut on a spring action, so it's not uncommon to hear doors slamming all day and night as people enter/exit their rooms, so if you're a light sleeper this might be a problem. When I was awake and didn't know what was going on, I just thought some kids were being disrespectful, but all of the doors seem to slam the same way. This property is not handicapped accessible. There are about 12 stairs up to get into the hotel, however there is an elevator once inside. Disabled travelers be advised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great base for exploring the city!”
Reviews.Author: bjimenez12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for six days. Hotel is in a great location on the Herengracht. Five minute walk to Dam Square, Anne Frank House, Red Light District. 15 minute walk to Central Station, but there are various tram lines by the hotel that run every couple of minutes. The hotel is very basic, and that was great for us because we spent almost no time in the room; too busy exploring the city. The room was small but the bed was very comfortable. The room was clean, bathroom was basic as well but clean. Service was prompt and friendly, in all we were satisfied with our stay. Bottom line - great base for exploring the city and it's main attractions. Very basic amenities, but clean and comfortable :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maggie2791
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned having booked this and then reading some bad reviews but on the whole the hotel was good. Our room was on the 2nd floor and the doors definitely banged shut! Also we smelt "weed" on our floor, despite the notice in the room saying you'd be fined 100 Euros if found smoking in the room. The room seemed clean enough and so was the bathroom, and we got new soap and shampoo every day. Depending on who was on reception determined whether you'd be helped or not! We wanted to check in our flight on line, but the computer printers were "broken" and the reception staff said they'd probably be "too busy" to help me print my boarding pass, so I went into town (difficult to find an internet cafe open). We had asked for an extra pillow which never arrived, despite asking twice. We gave up and used a rolled up towel! It's such a shame - we stayed there a few years ago and it was a great hotel. It is now owned by a Spanish company.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sevice”
Reviews.Author: rangIsrael
Reviews.Content: I came the Rembrndt claassic at 9 PM after i abooked it for 3 nights , in the receition the toild me that they are overbooked and they will arange a different hotel for the first and then i should come back it took more then an hour to arange it. when i came in the next morning to leave my staff it was so crowded it took me another hour . the room are fairly small and not very clean. it's not worth the value that you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but cramped expensive room”
Reviews.Author: Josie F
Reviews.Content: The Rembrandt is convenient for all popular sites in Amsterdam but it was costly and offered a very cramped room. Impossible to get out of bed without banging into the wall mounted TV. Rooms were clean and warm, breakfast was fine. Paying by credit card became an impossibility. My original payment was not accepted so had to use my debit card, then the hotel requires a refundable deposit on arrival, of 50 euros. Again the credit card was rejected. It was obvious that some visitors were asking for rooms to be changed. Since we were there for two nights only we decided to tolerate the tiny bedroom and bathroom. In the uK this hotel would have been half the price we paid, - or even less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: McFin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the beginning of October 2011. A fantastic location which was very easy to find we were initially very impressed by the hotel. Staff seemed friendly enough. First time in Amsterdam and a needed opportunity to relax and enjoy ourselves, brought back to reality with a bump when from 7am (could have been earlier!) the doors started banging. Not just doors closing as people came and went, doors banging, unable to sleep sounds like someone coming in to your room. We had no intention of getting up early and fully intended to sleep late in to the mornings after a late night out. Unfortunately this plan very quickly changed as the frustration turned to anger. An older hotel, you can tell it is in need of some TLC, rooms are a little tired but over all fine. Totally unnecessary amount of noise and something which really would stop me from re-visiting this hotel. A shame as otherwise it ticked all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ganit_w
Reviews.Content: We just came back last Monday, and after the shocking reviews regarding bed bugs, I must say - nothing alike. The hotel is very nice, breakfast was very generous, but arriving during the rush hour might result in waiting for a new bottle of water, or more croissants for 10 minutes. Another problem other people found was the size of the room - make sure not to get a twin room, since for some reason the took rooms that were supposed to be single rooms, ans shoved a big bed (well, not that big) in them, the result is extremely crowded. - request for a double bed, and you'll get a larger room with a normal size of a bed. The hotel is located 3 minutes from Dam square, so you get a great location for a night out (both Dam and Spui are within a short walking distance), most of the touristic things are also withing a short walking distance, and almost all tram lines reach the Dam, so you can basically get anywhere in the city very easily. Rooms are clean, and nice. for a three stars hotel we got everything we've expected and more. The staff - well, except for one receptionist that seemed to have a mental problem to really be helpful, all the rest were amazing, and did anything they could to help and explain.They also have a wide variety of languages spoken, which could be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to see Amsterdam centre”
Reviews.Author: elrond49
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March 2010 v cold, the hotel is a great base to see the sights in the city and most of them are easy walking, the trams are nearby, no food served apart from adequate continental breakfast, food in the evening is not a problem as there are a number of really good restaurants within walking distance. The Triple room we had was comfortable and warm. if you use the hotel just as a base then it is fine, anything else not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service by freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: jazzbabz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the recent IBC. My room was ready before 14h00. I'm sure the staff saw that after 11 hrs flight I was tired and sweaty. They were very friendly and helpful, and I really have to mention the night sstaff(vincent_ from brazil) was excellent from giving me tram tickets to organizing an itenary for me to follow so I could see something of amsterdam while working. The breakfast was excellent especiallyand the poffertjies and the brealfast staff was cordial and friendly. From the overworked porter/barman, to the cleaners and the front of house staff (edward and vincent(I hope I have the names right) I was treated and a friendly manner. For a single woman travelling for business it made me feel safe and welcome in a strange country. The room was great on the 4th floor spacious and very clean. And the best of all was the location.it was so close to everything that I could fit work and pleasure in. Do not miss the tapas bar in spuy street excellent for dinner. Enjoy this interesting city. I loved my stay. I will definitely come back and i will definitely stay in this lovely hotel. Having stayed in other hotels in europe, this is up to par with 3star and a very comfortable stay. I read reviews of the hotel before i went and can honestly say dont read the bad ones, none of the horror stories happened to me. I can imagine if you havent stayed in europe before you might expect something different. Bear in mind this is 3 star therefore you wont receive 5 star ammenities, but you will receive 5 star treatment from the staff. Treat them with respect and you might receive the same.Thanx

Reviews.Title: “No shower, naked man sleeping in my room”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: In 2006, I had a great experience at this hotel- but, back then, it was under the ownership of people who cared to keep up this hotel. No longer the case. I checked in after a long night of traveling and was given a room on an upper floor. Looked fine, until I went in the bathroom. Due to the sloping of the ceiling on that particular room, there was no shower- just a tub and a shower head about 2 feet off the ground. It's Europe, and that's fine- except I'm 6'1" and had I known I was getting a room without a proper shower I'd have booked somewhere else. I politely asked the front desk if I could be changed to another room that had a full shower and was told they were entirely full. A few minutes later the attendant returned to the desk and said he found a room with a shower, albeit a single bed. That was fine with me (even though I had paid for a King room) and I went up to the room to go to bed. No sooner did I open the door did I see a sleeping, naked man in the bed in front of me. Luckily I didn't wake him or there would be another terrible review of this hotel from HIS perspective. This should have ended it- but the attendant insisted that because the room was booked through a third party, there was no getting out of paying for my stay. I quickly booked at another hotel- who would stay there after that? To this day they have not issued a refund to the third party vendor, GetaRoom.com. Exactly who do you think you're fooling when you 1) try to sell rooms that have no showers as full-price rooms and 2) give out keys to rooms that are already occupied? Will we not find out, and worse yet post this on TripAdvisor?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpklm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rembrandt Classic Hotel in Amsterdam for two nights in June 2011 to attend a conference. This is a decent little hotel in a fantastic central location in Amsterdam for a good price. The hotel is located by a river, amongst cobblestone streets and traditional Dutch buildings. Amsterdam is an interesting city, and has a real personality of its own and is quite a pretty city. I arrived in Amsterdam by car and had no idea what problem parking was. The hotel had no parking but they offered a great solution for me: hotel staff arranged a type of valet service. A parking attendant came to pick up my car and took it to a garage outside the city. And when you want your car again, you just call and wait for about 20 minutes for them to bring it back. A brilliant solution to local parking problems! This classic Dutch building has lovely exteriors but is perhaps not in the best shape on the inside. The reception area felt a little less updated than my room, which was clean and fresh. Check-in could perhaps have been a bit more efficient. The interiors of the hotel was fairly basic North European hotel-design and perhaps not the most inspirational, but the location was great and its a fully decent hotel. My single room was on the first floor, small but not cramped, comfortable, qiuet, and had two lovely tall classic windows and a comfortable bed. Breakfast was included in the rate and was modest but sufficient. Be prepared to orient yourself in Amsterdam and bring a map and your hotel address once you leave the hotel, because its easy to get lost amongst all the waterways and roads if you have never been to Amsterdam before. Would I recommend the Rembrandt Classic Hotel? Yes. You get a small rate for an older hotel in a great location where you'd probably pay much more in other hotels. And the staff is helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR......NO!”
Reviews.Author: Heritage1
Reviews.Content: Bruges was less than half the price per night...but we were late into Amsterdam and hadn't booked...and there was a conference on (well there would be, wouldn't there?) but is this an excuse for scalping?Apparently. The hotel is tired , tired, tired but the beds were okay and it was reasonably clean- that's why I rated it a three.But everything involved an extra charge - info says free wifi for 1st half hr ... never worked. So all in all I would book well in advance and stay out of town...which is where we are now at Inn on the Lake.....gorgeous....watch this space as a review from the property while staying here would be bounced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice and quiet, large room with beautiful view, overall good value”
Reviews.Author: Southsea202
Reviews.Content: Check-in service short and efficient, requested a kingsize bed at time of booking, which was fulfilled along with a huge room. Hotel is a bit shabby and run-down, also there was a deposit required at check-in, as well as something else to do with freezing payment (my partner dealt with it so I am unsure) which seemed a bit unnecessary and was quite inconvenient when it came to the lengthy process of checking out (about half an hour!). The hotel is in a good location in a quiet side street, our room had beautiful views of the canal. Be warned if you are on the tall side though, as my partner managed to knock himself out on the low roof beams. Overall I thought it was good value for the deal we had, and would return if we were to have the same room as I've seen some of the others and they are tiny!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost! Ridiculously awful stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole W
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are both young women in our twenties who have visited Amsterdam several times and adore the city. We are both polite and reserved, and as a result I feel the hotel took advantage and treated us terribly. Firstly, the pros: This hotel is extremely well located, the rooms are fairly clean and of a decent size (at least for the price). Cons? Where do I start? On our first night a pipe burst in our room, spewing boiling hot water- steam and smoke filled the air quickly- across our bathroom and onto our carpeted bedroom. We gathered up our belongings (we both burnt our feet and had to wear shoes), stuffed everything back in our cases and exited the room. We were hastily given a second room, and being 3 in the morning and tired we accepted, presuming we wouldn't be charged for the room, at least for that night! The next day the entire floor was without hot water. As we were to find out, however, the receptionist had made no note at all on the system that the event had ever occured. In our second room, a window smashed with such force that I presumed someone had thrown something through it. What actually happened was more to do with the fact the hotel has ill-fitting, old fashioned and paper thin glass in the windows. The windows do not stay open independently- guests are required to prop them up with chunks of wood. The wind had blown one of these devices sideways, which resulted in our window slamming shut. The pressure had smashed the entire window. Luckily, both my friend and I were not near the area at the time, as shards of glass covered the carpet and one of the beds. The hotel, having no free room, boarded up the window with a sheet of carboard. Two days (!) later, my friend and I were doing our make-up at around 2pm when, without a knock or a phone call, two men walked into our room to fix the window. Now surely this is ridiculous? We should have at least been warned or asked beforehand. Our room was not cleaned for several days, we had to ask staff for clean towels at one point. The reception also checked us out a day earlier than we had booked, and we had to have our key cards re-activated. Again, no apology. Finally, upon checkout I was agast to discover we were to be charged for all five nights of our stay. The hotel did not offer us ANY compensation- not even a free breakfast- or even an apology. When we pointed this out to the staff they appeared confused and at first seemed to deny the flood on our first night had even occured. No note was made on the system, and we had to stand arguing as polietly as we could before a manager finally confirmed the event and printed us out a short letter with his signature for our insurance. We were not given an apology at all. I also have a problem with the method the hotel used to take payment- they freeze your assets and only unfreeze the amount at the end of your stay. Furthermore they took a 50 euro desposit on my card and I had to ask for this to be cancelled, as it was not on my invoice...I study law and I am fairly certain this is illegal. I love Amsterdam and have stayed several times before, and I have never encountered such a ridiculous turn of events. Both my friend and I are young women and I am also fairly certain the hotel treated us as they did because they felt they could get away with it- if I had been travelling with my mother I am sure they would have been a lot more apologetic! We have both made seperate official complaints to the hotel's Head Office, but, surprise surprise, have yet to hear back. I doubt we will. This hotel seems to have a knack for denying all wrong-doing. Don't stay in this hotel- accidents happen, of course, but the staff were rude and extremely unhelpful. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: GordonMackie
Reviews.Content: Excellent city break hotel. Clean, basic and very well located for sightseeing and walking from the station. Breakfast is extra but good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Assistance from Staff”
Reviews.Author: UncleGobo
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd write this review just to compliment the staff at reception who were very helpful during my stay here. They were always willing to be of assistance, especially when at very short notice I required additional rooms, and also with a late check out. Location very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best by any means”
Reviews.Author: HIMANDHER82
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights first the good things or should i say the good thing it was the staff they are friendly thats it now the bad thingssssssss first we where put into a closet which they called a double room the bed was supposed to be a double it was a large single then we got bites all over our body i didnt know if it was bed bugs or something from the canel as we had to leave the windows open because there was no air getting into the room with the window closed the decor was dirty all over the hotel? i watched one lady cleaner cleaning a room she was in and out in 7mins and if her atire was anything to go by i can imagine what the room was like when she finished dont go to this hotel?you will be disapointed i will be contacting the amsterdam athurites to ask what its there difference between a hotel and a hostel also i will be contacting the people i booked through easytobook online reservation tese people say we they have nothing to do with the hotel but they are willing to advertise for them and get paid everytime someone books through their site DONT GO HERE YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “"Even if they pay me, I wont go back"”
Reviews.Author: haraldmarkd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel some time ago (forgot the exact date). Just terrible. The hotel is old, the lazy staff extremely unfriendly, the coffee can be used as rat poison. Staff refused to accept dollars ("this is euro country"). Refused to change dollars into euro ("we don't know rate"). Luckily they became rather active around 11.40 in the morning as one guy knocked on door of room and said: "You have 20 minutes. If you stay longer than twenty minutes, we will charge you for extra day". Eh, good morning to you too... In short, very crappy place, would not stay there again, even if they pay me. Only good thing: location in center.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: LinBoston
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean. Location was great. Despite it being a non-smoking hotel, there was a lot of cigarette smoke in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “The best location with really nice room”
Reviews.Author: Luchy_F
Reviews.Content: Before flying there i was a bit concerned because of some reviews here , None of them became true. I payed extra for a room with a canal view and some more for WIFI access and my stay Was really great. The location is superb , in 5 -10 minutes walk you can get to most central places, The canals are the biggest attraction and you are already there.5-10 minutes walk from yurdan . the canal view is great as well and its much more quite then hotels near a road. The breakfast is simple and good, I will not try to find a deferent hotel next time i go there , it was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kath076
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our recent honeymoon. We found the staff helpful and courteous. The hotel was clean and the room was great â€œtop two windows on left as you look at picture of the front of the hotelâ€� we did get an upgrade as it was our honeymoon but the other rooms although smaller seemed to be very nice too. We had the windows open at night as there is no air con and we did get a few mosquito bites but warm weather near water we should have been prepared. This hotel compared very well to the other hotels I have stayed in in Amsterdam which were both 4 star. They had more facilities but as we were just using it as a base we would not have used them anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Beware deposit scam”
Reviews.Author: OorWullie2011
Reviews.Content: Don't fall for the scam of 'local tax' when checking out. Fifty euro deposit is taken when checking in for 'incidental' expenses. They then try and hold most of it back when you are leaving saying it is a local tax. We paid fully for our trip through a travel agent in UK before travelling so if the hotel have a problem with that they should take it up with them. Kick up a stink like we did and they will back down though. It makes you wonder how many people have been conned with this trick?

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: katendave
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute for a weekend break. The hotel is very centrally situated close to attractions and tram lines. We had a triple room which was much larger than i expected and clean. The hotel could do with some general maintenance such as painting the walls and doors. The staff were very helpful and friendly. we didn't eat in the hotel as 8.5 euros each for breakfast seemed a lot. Only complaint i have is that unfortunately we required a doctor during our visit and even after telling the reception staff we had European health cards we were provided with a doctor who insisted on being paid. we were told to reclaim in the UK but having returned home we found out we should have started the claim in Amsterdam and that we may have been sent a private doctor who would not be covered. (he was also completely useless, took no medical history and gave us unsuitable pills cut off a strip with no information about them) All in all a good place to stay for a couple of days as long as you don't want luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged”
Reviews.Author: porterize1995
Reviews.Content: Our January reservation, confirmed and paid for, showed 2 types of taxes. Upon our arrival May 2 they surprised us with additional tax. The room was expensive, small, and had no air condition. Then to demand additional money was a shakedown.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a dump”
Reviews.Author: elizabethsutton
Reviews.Content: my husband and I were very disappointed in this Classic Hotel Rembrant... only the name has anything classic in it... the hotel is old, run down, small rooms and staff with an attitude... we paid in advance for what we were told would be a great hotel and the room they put us in wasn't big enough to "swing a cat"... I've seen bigger closets. Noise from the hallways and streets would wake us up... we had to keep the windows open because you could not turn down the heat in the room.. overall, the best thing I can say is that is is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in town”
Reviews.Author: lisa71Skp
Reviews.Content: We were in Amsterdam for a long weekend(14-18.04) and we staid in Remrannd Classic.Perfect location.Buy special traveler ticket for tram for 72 hours and from the central station get of at Dam sq..From there pass Singel canal and on the second street turn left.You will see the hotel very quick.With the map in your hand it s easy to travel around.We also whent to Efteling and we enjoy a lot this fantastic kids park. The hotel is a bit old but ok...Breakfast standard for every hotel at same rank(3 stars).Since we was out all day,that doesn't bother us.Clean towels were left for us every day.Necessary is to leave 50 e. deposit.On way home you will get the many back.

Reviews.Title: “Average, and I wasn't the only one in the room”
Reviews.Author: ShelovesEcudaor
Reviews.Content: The hotel's average, adequate. Room 111 was interior facing and quiet. But the reason I'm writing this review is because today I've got bites on my hands, and arms. I killed one pesky looking mosquito type fly, but I think there were more or perhaps something else living in the room which has bitten me. Very very itchy and I'm about to go out and buy antihistamines...

Reviews.Title: “Great pretty location, clean rooms & nice staff.......what more do you need !”
Reviews.Author: willic
Reviews.Content: I had booked this as a Christmas pressie for my boyfriend. We are in our mid 30's & it was our first holiday together & considering that hotels are so expensive in Amsterdam........this turned out to be perfect! I wanted a hotel in a good central location, i wanted an okay price & i wanted a clean comfortable room with towels. All this was exactly what we got! We asked for a room with a canal view & we got it! It was just 10 mins from Damm square & was in a nice pretty location on one of the main canals. The hotel was quiet apart from the cleaners cleaning at 9am every morning! We paid â‚¬358 for 3 nights (+ city tax) so it ended up as â‚¬375 for 3 night which for Amsterdam is not bad! You will need to give them a â‚¬50 deposit when you arrive but you get this back on the last day so don't worry. We were there for a weekend of drinking and eating & were not in our room that much but we did walk back for a 1/2 nap one day which is easily done!! Just down the road too, the next bridge to your left is Nine stratjes ( a road of vintage shops & lovely cafes) Literally 5 mins walk!! Fab!! If you did want a more luxurious hotel, on our travels we found Hotel esterea on Singel. This looked so pretty but was a hefty â‚¬250 a night.......maybe go back there when I win the lottery!!! So my advice is book this hotel if it's in your budjet but don't expect luxury, its just a simple hotel in a beautiful location !! I will definitely go back there! Enjoy . Clare from liverpool x

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly service & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: InvernessMatt1971
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Amsterdam having stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. Our triple room was very clean and spacious. A double bed, single bed and sofa bed also had a nice canal view. The location is great close enough to the centre but far enough away to get some peace and quiet. It's was a lads weekend but that said I would return with my wife and daughter. To be recommended

Reviews.Title: “A curate's egg: good in parts”
Reviews.Author: sayitasiseeit
Reviews.Content: Good points: Excellent central canal-side location. Large comfortable room over-looking canal. Reasonably priced booked through Alpha Rooms. Receptionists arranged taxis. (Incidentally, beware of rip-off taxis at the station: we were charged â‚¬20 for the short trip from the station to the hotel). Bad points: The decor is very tired and the whole place could do with a complete overhaul. The breakfast buffet was reasonable on the first (Saturday) morning but by Monday morning they seemed to have run out of most things. I would like to think that there are better hotels for the same money and equally well located.

Reviews.Title: “1 star hotel in lots of ways way”
Reviews.Author: EyeSpy007
Reviews.Content: Greeted by a surly young female receptionist who allocated us a room that we did not book, she refused to re allocate to another room however the manager stepped in after hearing the altercation. 1st night woken at 5.00 am in the morning by next adjoining room hold a drinks and drug get together. It took 3 complaints to the nignt porter before the hotel staff did something about it. Exactly, the same thing happened next morning only when I argued with the hotel staff they should call the police did they bother to do anything about. Poor customer service of the lowest standard. The breakfast was a joke vastly understaffed in the restaurant I felt sorry for the 2 guys attempting to clear 30 tables as well as ensuring enough cutlery and food was available to guests the food slectoon was minimal and sometimes looked like it had been around for sometime. This hotel is being run on a shoestring and would not recommend it for location and customer service. The hotel was clean however it could not make up for the very bad points.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Lamppu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic but adequate. The location is really good with very nice shops in the immediate vicinity. The ground floor room was huge and clean. No view, however, but we just slept there so it didn't matter. Good beds, nice TV. Tricky shower taps - it was difficult to get anything but boiling hot water even though the cold tap was on maximum. At this price I would go back and also recommend it. Had breakfast once. Ok, but really very ordinary. The staff at check in was aloof. Nice on the other days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Debs10
Reviews.Content: We paid 100 Euros per night for a twin room with canal view & breakfast. Hotel is in a nice quiet street but very close to main square and Anne Frank House. Decor is dated and there is no restaurant. Check-in could have been quicker, but on the plus side the room (324) was big and clean, with a lovely view and the breakfast was excellent. Not luxurious but if you are looking for clean, comfortable and quiet I would recommend. You will have to pay a 50 Euros deposit and city tax on your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Two stars maximum”
Reviews.Author: Betulla
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Unfriendly, uninterested personnel, dirty old rooms - bedsheet etc. were all right though. Breakfast the level of youth hostels, with instant coffee from automates etc. Worst the noisiness: my room was very small, and the huge air conditioning machinen (or something the like) in the inner yard right behind the little window as well as a powerful air conditioning in the bathroom open all the time made it unpossible to sleep at all. The situation was not helped by the wide open space under the door to the corridor - light and every single sound, travellers speaking and shouting etc, came profusely in all night. The personnel was not interested to find me another room for another night - just shrugged at my notice that the room should not be used.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: didaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Dam Square and the Red Light District. It is close to Anne Frank's House and the It is 15 minutes walking distance from Amsterdam Centraal (the train station). It is also very close to the shopping district and to nice bars and restaurants. I booked a double room (315) which was quite small and very basic. It was neglected but was clean. The breakfast was very generous and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel...very good location”
Reviews.Author: missgemgem
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on here we were a little worried about going to this hotel. However we were pleasantly surprised. We arrived at around 11am and were able to check in early which was a relief as we were shattered!! The Customer service was very good, the staff all seemed very friendly. The room was quite small and could of been a bit larger for the amount of money we paid, however it was clean and comfortable. The nets and curtains were quite a disgrace if im honest...didnt close properly and seemed dirty and had a lot of holes....a let down for the room. The bathroom was clean and there was a good shower!! There was some noise to be heard from our room, not sure if this was because we were right by the front desk/entrance?...noise from people and working..ie drills!! but it wasnt too bad. Also the printers were not working at the internet station...we needed these to print off our boarding passes! wasnt told this until we had put our money in to print!! However we were able to use the check in desk computer because of what we were printing....but no sign of a refund for our lost money in the printer :-( Also they add on city tax to the total cost of the stay, which wasnt loads, but not at all mentioned when booking so be sure to take a little extra, we paid an extra 10euro..also make sure you have change or exact amount for the total cost of your stay as we were not allowed our change until we left???? not sure why?? Overall a very good hotel in a lovely area, about 10 mins from leidseplein and dam square!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional. For a 3 star Euro hotel the rooms are huge, the views of the canal (Herengeraacht) outside are atmospheric, the location, despite being very quiet is a pleasant 10 minute stroll to Dam Square, and only 5 minutes to Anne Franks House. The staff were very helpful and friendly despite the fact we turned up at gone midnight a little wiped from our day in Amsterdam. For the price this hotel really is head and shoulders above its peers, which in Amsterdam can be very seedy. Always stay here when in the `Dam.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very reasonable price for amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sallyann82
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights in the rembrandt classic and was very pleasantly surprised. We paid â‚¬40 each per night excluding breakfast. The room (326) was very big for amsterdam, the beds were really comfortable with lovely pillows. The building itself is quiet old and the decor is a bit dated but for the price we paid we would absolutely stay here again. The room itself over looked the canal and there was a safe box for no additional cost. We were able to check in early and found the staff helpful, they even brought a bucket of ice up to the room for us to chill our own wine and rang around various restaurants to make our reservations. We did have a bit of trouble checking out though as we were told that our credit card was only authorised and payment had not gone through.. after a bit of arguing (we had paid on arrival) they agreed that the payment had in fact been processed. Location is excellent and we did not hear any noise from either any other rooms or from the street. Anyone visiting Amsterdam should beware the taxi drivers.. If they think your a tourist they will try to rip you off.. should only cost about 7.50 - 10 per trip around the city centre.. we had 2 separate taxi drivers trying to charge our group â‚¬5 each! Rembrandtplein is great for nightlife even on a Sunday when things are generally very quiet and is about 5 mins in a taxi. The only downside about this hotel was that we could not smoke and had to go down 3 floors to stand out in the blustering wind as there was no smoking area given that it is an old building. Free wifi for 30 mins with charge after that but we could not actually get the internet to connect, possibly due to the bad weather. Cant wait to come back again and will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD IF YOU GET A CHEAP PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: campbellina87
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from staying here for just one evening. Its location was great if you want to be slightly out of the craziness of the city centre, but only a 5minute walk to Dam Sq, 10min walk to Red Light District and the coffee shops. The room was clean, really nothing special..just fine! Found the staff to be quite rude. Not too friendly. They didnt have our booking in their system when we arrived and we were marched off to a waiting room without much explanation as to what was happening. Then we had to hand over 50euro as a deposit which wasnt mentioned at any point during our booking. When we got the deposit back, 3euro had been taken off for 'city tax' Err, cant say I have heard of this before!? And the day before we were assured we would get the whole 50euro back? Still on the plus side we were allowed to check in early, and they held our baggage for us after check out the next day. We booked on Trivago, and got it for Â£45, for that price, the hotel is great! But I would be a little gutted if we had paid anymore. Make sure you request a canal view also! We didnt..mistake!! All in all, it was just OK!! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect but it's up to the room you'll get!”
Reviews.Author: tassosGR
Reviews.Content: I booked 1 double room through the hotel's website. Because of a connection failure on the time of the booking, the system booked 2 rooms without me realising so, even though I received 2 confirmation e-mails. Actually I though they were for the same room. So when we arrived they gave us 2 rooms, I told them it was a mistake, in the begining they were saying they can't do nothing about it but finally they agreed to cancel the 2nd room. Then we went to our room which was very small with a semi double bed , no way a double room and view of a interior yard. We could barely fit in! So next morning I asked from a very polite girl at the reception if it was possible to move to a bigger room and even pay extra if needed. She gave us a penthouse ( 4th floor ) canal view room without any extra charge! The room was nice, comfortable with a bathtub bathroom and beautiful view of the canal and the city! The room was clean every day and the breakfast was good and had a variety. Staff was mostly polite and helpful. But the best part is the location! The hotel is located on a beautiful and quiet canal but still just 5 minutes walk to the Damrak square! All the main attractions are within walking distance, for 6 days we didn't use anything but our foot, not even a bicycle! And at the end of every day we had a nice sleep, no noise or something. Overall is a good choice if you get one of the good rooms, which are the ones with a canal view and if on the 4th floor even better. I would go back if it was for the same room, I think it was 422 but not sure, or similar but if it was for something like the room I got at first, I would look for an other place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Steffi11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay here. We have been to Amsterdam several times before and this is the best Hotel I have stayed in. Check In was quick and very friendly and we were given lots of information. We had a room on the 4th floor at the back of the building and it was very clean, not the most modern room but all you do is sleep in it anyway. We didnt have breakfast as we just grabbed a coffee and pastry in town. The Hotel is a 15minute walk from Centraal Station and about 5minutes from the Dam Square and all the shops. I would definitley stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a night or two.”
Reviews.Author: MyriamMorenaRamirez
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that i read like a thousand reviews on tripadvisor before goin to Amsterdam. I don't really like hotels because I have a cleanliness disorder, I check everything 100th times before i can really feel comfortable. Well i wrote down several hotels on a paper and when I arrived in Amsterdam I went to 5-6 hotels to aks what the price was for one night (but I knew the prices, I just wanted to see the first impression). I was travelling with my mother so we wanted something close to the centre and a nice, safe neigbourhood, So we ended up at Hotel Rembrandt Classic, the woman at the desk was very friendly she couldn't speak dutch, but that was okay with me, i speak english and spanish too. We paid 64euros for a two-single room without breakfast. The room was nice, very clean the bathroom also! There were plenty of towels. The only thing that we saw as negative is that alot of people close their hoteldoors so hard, but you have to because otherwise it will not close!! It was also a bit to warm in the rooms, but you can open up the windows so....A 600metre walk brought us to the city centre, al the main shopping spots like Kalverstraat an 9straatjes were within walking distance. Madame tussauds, Damrak, Central Station just everything was within walking distance! If you're looking for a clean hotel that has a nice location and is average in its price this is the spot for you!

Reviews.Title: “Centrum w/ canal views of amsterdam love it!”
Reviews.Author: yngtraveler
Reviews.Content: Well i guess my first tip would be to sweet talk the person at the counter as i did cause i ended up with a room that had a canal view!!!! and for no extra charge which was beautiful... the rooms are not amazing could use an update, but honestly im not in the hotel enough to care! and for 2 people at 77US a nite with a canal view and walking distance to all sites i cant really complain! The hotel is in an excellent location you cant ask for more... walking distance to everything! the people at the front desk were nice but not that customer orientated such as i wanted internet had cash but they were counting cash so i had to charge it... just take my cash and figure it out later why both me with having to pay later when i have the money?? just little things like that... but they were friendly... i also took offense when i tried to use my creditcard and it never went through (their machine problem!!) and the girl said to me well maybe you dont have any money?? i was rather offended that you make a comment like that... i would forsure stay at the hotel again mostly cause of the location and if i could swing another canal view room thats just another bonus of being in amsterdam! also parkin was only valet for 25 euro a nite! yikes but i was way to tired to wander around looking for a parking spot...

Reviews.Title: “Price was high, but it was a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: jubbing
Reviews.Content: The Location was quite good, only about a 10 minute decent paced walk to the Dam (Amsterdam Center). We arrived a little later than expected (7pm) because we missed our flight in London (chalk that up to slow security), and when we got there we were informed we had been upgraded to a Canal view room (which made the morning view amazing!) from a standard double. While the price was a little higher than we would have wanted, upgrading us made it quite a bit better. The hotel staff spoke perfect english and were fairly helpful when we were asking information. The hotel was clean, but with the room, I would have liked if the heaters could have been turned up a little more (but it wasn't too big an inconvinience). The room was decently sized, but not big (but nicely sized for two people to have their suitcases open and still not having to step over them) If in Amsterdam, take the Free Walking tour (the end point is quite near the hotel, so its convinient if you get lost). Overall a good stay, and recommended (although book earlier than we did to get a better price).

Reviews.Title: “what an upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: bevhinde
Reviews.Content: me and my partner arrived at the hotel at 12 noon, 2 hours before chesck-in. the receptionist (lovely asian gent) let us check-in early but to my dissapointment he said there were no double rooms left so so we'd have to have the kingsize-bonus. i think iwas expecting the standard kingsize that we have in the uk but when i walked into the room it was huuuuge-massive-like two doubles pushed together without the gap in the middle. the room was so big- it was bigger then the whole of my down stairs at home and i have 4 rooms. i was very impressed. it was so vintage looking-classic, i felt posh. oh it had a big table in the middle of the room and there was still space to roll around on the floor-loved it! had to pay 2.50euro's thou for the tea making facilities...i did not mind-i got a hotel barging of a life time...very monica and chandler :-) 2streets away from dam sq too, no hard walking getting lost-simple:) if you walk down to the bridge on your left as you come out of the hotel turn right and carry onto on the the 9th streets-great boozer on the right as you enter the street-cheaper by 3-4 euro's for dutch's best i think its a jamacian pub. no frill's just good beer and friendly company. ***** free internet for half an hour too ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SCohen48
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, nice bars & restaurants nearby. Stayed in room at top in eaves, would highly reccomend this room. Breakfast was fine. Would stay here again in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located, but ridicolously overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: kermitpise
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night - and would not have stayed longer - in a fairly small double room, with very basic and poor quality furniture. More like a hostel rather than a 160 EUR/night hotel. The room was clean but in the communal areas of the hotel - including main entrance - you could feel a very unpleasant smell of smoke (no one was smoking inside as forbidden, but i think it used to be a smoking hotel and the walls have not been repainted ever since. Friendly staff and excellent location, on a canal on the eastern border of Jordaan and a 10mins walk from the main train station and 5mins from Dam square. Will definitely not return.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump”
Reviews.Author: youbettertreatmegood
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling all over the world in all kind of dumps but I felt really cheated with this hotel. If value for money is what you look for in an hotel, I can confirm that this is the worst performing hotel I encountered in my life. If you ask me how much I'd pay for it, I would answer 45â‚¬ max. The bill came at 160â‚¬ per night. Something is wrong. The fact that everyone says that location is good does not count in this instance. It's not like you are in London or Paris and you need to be in a good location. It is very easy to get around in Amsterdam. On the other hand I wouldn't stay in the hotel areas - definitely not safe Here are the cons: - Room is tiny. In need of refurbishment. Looks like a caravan. - 15 euros for 24 hrs wifi. This is like charging for the toilet for a business traveller. Shame on you! - No air in the room. Can't open the window because of mosquitos. I killed 10 of them the first night. Hate to kill animals but I couldn't sleep - Bathroom resembles the one on the plane to get to Amsterdam - Staff trying to be nice but not really succeeding, including unwanted joke on my name. Lame! - Position is good but again I am sure there is some illegal activity going on on the bench outside as I 've seen weird looking individuals trafficking a lot. Not safe at all. Conclusion 160â‚¬ is a complete rip-off. I travel to Amsterdam once every two months and I am getting to know the city. Therefore avoid it if possible. Follow Tripadvisor suggestions and head to the Citizen M - where I am currently. 60 quid less and amazing value, great coffee, free wifi, specials when you check in on Foursquare. All new and refurbished. Out of the way yeah but amazingly connected. Instant love. This is what I am talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: alnayres
Reviews.Content: The bathroom facilities were extremely clean lke the rest of the hotel, however, the toilet area was very small and dificult to use, if you are tall or carry a bit of extra weight you stand no chance of being able to sit on the toilet in comfort

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jonster_201
Reviews.Content: For this trip to 'the dam' we wanted to be a bit more central, and we hit jackpot with this hotel. Right next to a canal, its around 5 mins walk to Dam square, and the same to Jordaan or the Nine Little Lanes. Leidsplein and other more interesting parts are also just a short walk away. The hotel itself is ok, it has a grand entrance hall with a reception desk staffed by smiley staff members. The room was quite small, but large enough to cope with for just a few nights, but as the city was so close we hardly spent any time in there anyway. The staff were helpful, offering advice about what to see and do, and happy to look after cases after we checked out and went to get some lunch. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, strange rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bes1
Reviews.Content: Together with a colleague I had to visit our office in Amsterdam and therefore we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the city center. We found several hotels online, but the location of this hotel simply seemed perfect, so we decided to go for it. From Amsterdam Central Station it took us approx. 15 mins by walk, the location of the hotel is really great indeed, esp. when you're a tourist. I found it a bit strange that nobody at the reception of the hotel was able to speak Dutch. Also, there were no Dutch channels on tv! Of course this is probably not the main reason for people to visit Amsterdam, but still.. not even one word of Dutch? Bit of a bummer when you're in your own capital. The way to my room was strange as well, I had to walk through a lot of smelly hallways, it kind of looked like a hostel basically. In the middle of the hallway there was a bed turned upside down, blocking the entrance to a room. Weird. My room itself was huge, with a great view upon the Herengracht. But: the furniture was old, the curtains were so dirty that I was almost afraid to touch them, there were weird stains on the carpet and the bed was not comfortable at all. The room also didn't have airconditioning, so it was extremely warm! The bathroom was old as well, but really extremely clean. All in all, bit strange, but great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: candh2010
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheaper hotels in Amsterdam and the location was great! Not far from Dam Square so central enough. Rooms were comfortable but not spectacular. Breakfast was an extra at 8.5 euros per person so not cheap. No coffee making facilities supplied free unless you wanted to pay 10 euros per day which was two coffee/tea cup allowance. The location was its best feature but not cheap enough to make it outstanding. If your threr for the nightlife then its not at all far

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: puterconsultant
Reviews.Content: Room had no air conditioning, windows wouldn't open, and they never replaced used glasses with clean ones. Couldn't sleep at night because the room would get very hot without any ventilation. Very noisy even though room was not street facing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SofiaLeRed619
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rembrandt with my mom for a mother-daughter weekend trip to Amsterdam. The location is very centrally located and easy to walk to all the action but it is in a quiet area along one of the canals and boarders the beautiful Jordain area. Stepping out of the hotel directly onto a picturesque canal was exactly what I envisioned. Although some of the rooms have views, ours faced an inner courtyard which made for a quiet and peaceful stay. For the price (we didn't want to spend hundreds of Euros per night just for a place to sleep), and the location (convenient and yet quiet), I would definitely recommend the Rembrandt and would consider staying here again next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose but wouldn't hurry back to.”
Reviews.Author: WeAreScientists
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights last week and was impressed by the central location of the hotel and its proximity to many places of interest. The check in and check out processes were very quick but lacked any kind of pleasantries. I found the reception staff a bit clueless when asked about the 'Connexxion Schiphol Hotel Shuttle' - which is listed on the IAmsterdam website. None of them had ever heard of it and were fairly unwilling to arrange our trip back to the airport with them for us. The room was larger than expected and had a magnificent view of the canal. However the bathroom walls had quite a number of long, dark hairs on them. Towels were changed and beds made every day. The walls of the hotel must be paper-thin as every time a door closed somewhere it reverbarated round our room and my friend said that they heard someone pulling their shower curtain across one morning! The room was very hot and not air-conditioned which meant we had to prop the window open as wide as we could to get some air - which was not too comforting when we were in a ground floor room! I certainly wouldn't rush back to this hotel but it did serve its purpose and was priced reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daviesfamily09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week with two friends, we had a very large triple room on the ground floor. Ive stayed in amsterdam quite a few times but this time was going on a bit of a budget and rembrandt gave very good rates for what was still a good and central location. The room was large, clean and the beds were SO comfortable. The cleaner's came and cleaned thoroughly every day and replaced bedding and towels....however, they did start cleaning about 8am, which after being out until 2am wasn't the nicest wakeup!! The only bad things were that the hotel was SO SO hot, I hate the cold but this place was ridiculously warm even for me!! We had to sleep with the windows open all night which led to a few biting insects getting in! They really need to put air conditioning in! The Spanish speaking lady at reception was really helpful, welcoming and had a cheerful smile...the others unfortunately not so friendly....they all looked rather glum! Overall a good experience, i would go back to this hotel but do prefer the area down near the tulip market but thats simply personal preference!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think”
Reviews.Author: HOSTAN
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at this hotel. On my arrival at noon, I was told that the check in time was at 2. No problem. I went to have lunch, when I came back, the checkin lasted half an hour, even though I was the only guest. Then they gave me a key and sent me to the room. The key did not function, came back to the reception, they gave me another key. It did not function neighter. Then they gave me another room saying that, it is very common for them to have this lock problem. When I entered the room, I realized that the room was not clean at all. There was a footprint on the bed. All the materials on the bed was from the middle age, for sure. The room does not have an AC, and as tiny as a queen size bed. As I was supposed to stay overnight, I did not change my hotel. If you do stay one single night, and do not intend to sleep in park, this hotel can be an option. Otherwise, it is better to stay in the station. The station will be quieter for sure. It is impossible to have a good sleep in the room as all the noise outside seem to occur in your room. By the way, If you want help from the reception, find Marian, the rest of the staff is like guardians.

Reviews.Title: “Had no other choice”
Reviews.Author: kallirache
Reviews.Content: Again a hotle we had to stay in because of the volcano, and this one had an amazing location, right on the canal. unfortunatly our room was not facing the canal but instead was facing the courtyard. I would say that the hotel was alright but again it could have been better. the prices shot up because of the volcano so i cannot say what was the "real" price for the rooms but what we paid we was not worth it. the rooms were ok clean and had a tv but it wasnt anything special.and our bathroom had a leak so the floor was flooded. it was ok not too bad but i wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: see_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good value for money, ideally situated within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go to. The staff were friendly and helpful. A minor problem was sorted immediately. Having read the negative comments after we booked I felt I had to add my comments as I could see no evidence of the awful place others had described

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby, in a good location, with so-so staff”
Reviews.Author: jack06Maine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, just off a main street in central Amsterdam, on a quiet canal street. It is a 3 star hotel which may account for the stained carpeting, thin towels, and some snooty reception staff. The breakfast, although a reasonable price, was consistently out of items, had stale pastries and funny tasting eggs. Some of the rooms are tiny, so try to request a large room, if the staff will indulge your request.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable, fairly priced hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Kateflood
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was clean, well decorated and comfortable - upon arrival we were greeted with a smile, and had our bags carried, despite speaking no Dutch and being a little late for check-in due to our flight being delayed because of the snow. While the hotel was reasonably priced, food & drink within the hotel was fairly expensive. It was cheaper to go out to eat in a pub/bar or similar and so that's what we did. The room service was good enough - quick to respond, but closed very early. I'm pretty sure the bar/restaurant had the same opening times as the room service, which just seemed pointless to me - but then maybe that's how it's done in Holland, I don't know. All the people I encountered on reception were very helpful, and fluent in English. The whole hotel was clean, tidy and comfortable, as well as being warm and well lit. Our room was spacious and clean, and our bed was very comfortable - the one complaint being that the cleaner knocked on our door at about 8 AM everyday we were there. Not something you want when you're paying to go away for a relaxing break ! The location of the hotel is ideal - on a quiet street, but within a five minute walk of everything you could want from Amsterdam - canals, shopping, smoking cafes and restaurants, tram stops and Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and very low ceilings”
Reviews.Author: Dandy33
Reviews.Content: All three of us woke up with bed bug bites after staying here - I had about 30 bites all in one night! The ceiling of the room we stayed in, which faced onto the canal, was very low and the two 6 foot 4" people I was staying with had to duck their heads to walk around. The bathroom was tiny, although clean. The two tall people had to double over to use the shower as the ceiling and shower head were so low. My Dutch friend also noted that the staff didn't seem able to speak Dutch, although their English was ok. Apart from the low ceilings, the room was a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what you get - "free" internet not so free”
Reviews.Author: kend0
Reviews.Content: Good location, comfortable room but not best value for money. "Free" internet was only valid for first 30 minutes which is not clear on website. Next time would stay at a better quality just outside of central Amsterdam to get a better value hotel. Everything is easy to get to via tram or walking anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, friendly service, average comfort levels...”
Reviews.Author: campcrusader
Reviews.Content: The Rembrandt Classic is in an amazingly good location, right alongside a canal, minutes from Dam Square and shops, cafes and bars. The hotel is pleasant enough, with very friendly staff, and reasonable rooms. However, the rooms are quite small, and there is not any air conditioning. The rooms were stiflingly hot as our stay coincided with 30c heat. Leaving the windows open at night made sleep difficult, as there was a lot of noise from people passing by on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruscombeone
Reviews.Content: Having sen the diverse comments about this hotel which I booked for a 50th birthday celebration I was quite apprehensive. I neednt have been.
