The hotel was very good , clean and a great location to explore Amsterdam. Rooms were larger than expected, spotless and cleaned daily . Some touching up of the paintwork was required in the bathroom. We asked for coffee and tea making facilities at the reception- within 5 minutes there was a knock on the door delivering the same. Very quiet in the evening- nothging to disturb our sleep. Only gripe- the hotel bar closed at 9.30 sharp- there were a number of bars in walking disttance, so no real problem. Buffet breakfast was very good with a lot of chouice- cooked foods, fruit, meat, cheese, bread and cakes and plenty of drinks. Would definately return to the hotel again if in Amsterdam. ps.. Excellent cafe/ bar opposite the central stationat Prins Hendrikkade- went in for coffee- stayed for coffee, drink and meal> Bartender excellent serbvice and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but alright”
Reviews.Author: hahaandy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location right near all of the main attractions of Amsterdam. Unfortunately it does not live up to its potential. We had to move rooms after the room we spent our first night in had a leak in the roof. Nobody made us aware of this and I had to visit the reception about three times to get them to realise we needed to move rooms. After this we received a large canal view room which was very nice ... but the shower did not work properly. Rooms were basic but clean, not too noisy - but we weren't staying at the weekend when it may be noisier.

Reviews.Title: “Terrbile service”
Reviews.Author: RachelBeas
Reviews.Content: The hotel roomes look nothing like the website shows. Staff were extremely unhelpful, even when our en suite ceiling started leaking! We called several times and no one came to sort out the problem, finally we went out for the day. To top if off when we got the bin to catch the leak there was a dirty tampon in it (obviously emptyin bins before next guests arrive is not a priority). When we did come back we then were put into a room with 2 single beds. Freezing cold room as an air vent was stuck open. On the day we left, even though they state they have a luggage room they would only look after out bags till 2pm (our flight was at 10pm). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I will add photos showing the difference between the room we stayed in and what the website shows, i will also show the leaking ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Death Trap”
Reviews.Author: amaan786
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst i have every stayed in Europe! Pictures of hotel are nothing of the sort. The beds have bed bugs and the en-suites (if thats what you cal em) are worst then a community centre.....corridors, RAT INFESTED!

Reviews.Title: “could find no fault”
Reviews.Author: aggyabroad
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Amsterdam and thought the hotel offered great value for money .We had two large rooms for our family for our three night stay.The staff were friendly and helpful,the hotel clean and light and the breakfast was perfectly adequate.The only faults I could find and they are more niggles if I'm honest are the fact that there were no tea and coffee facilites in the rooms,which to be fair they do state ,and the fact that to keep the window open I had to tie it with cotton! the room was quite hot! The hotel was perfectly situated for easy walking to all the main sights although finding it when we first arrived proved a little tricky a taxi from the station would have been a good idea prehaps but you live and learn and it was only a ten minute walk and easy enough to do if you know where you're going and can follow a map! We plan to go back and stay there again soon so it must have been o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Travellover353
Reviews.Content: I requested a non-smoking room, a high floor room and early check-in. The room was not available until 2.30pm. We were assigned Room No 4 on the ground floor. The room was a non-smoking room, however there was a constant odor of tobacco and alcohol on the corridor, especially in the mornings. I understand requests cannot be always guaranteed. I presented the hotel voucher at check-in. We completed the usual hotel details, authorisation of my credit card was requested, left our luggage and returned at 2.30pm. The receptionist who assigned us Room No 4 insisted that breakfast or city tax was not included in the booking. She was very rude and did not offer any apology when I referred to the hotel voucher and drew her attention to the booking details. As we were catching an early flight on Monday Dec 28th we checked out before 6am. I met the same receptionist who presented me with a bill for city tax and breakfast. Again I made reference to the hotel voucher, she shrugged her shoulders, returned to the computer and said city tax is never included in a booking and demanded â‚¬7. All other staff were helpful and friendly. Amsterdam is a wonderful city! We will be back soon but we certainly will not be staying at the Rembrandt Classic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware bedbugs-this hotel is rubbish”
Reviews.Author: cinemagirlBendigo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rubbish. We stayed for two nights after seeing it on hotel.com. We had to put up with a broken showerhead and a terrible breakfast. This we could deal with but the worst was the fact that we were bitten by bedbugs. When I complained I was told that I must have brought them into the hotel with me!!! The manager was patronizing and insincere and absolutely refused to acknowledge that there were bedbugs in the room, even though he'd already admitted there'd been 3 cases of bedbugs reported this year alone. He said that it takes two days for the bites to become visible and that I need to wash all my clothes so I don't infect the next hotel we stay at. I was floored and explained that we had already had our clothes washed the day before and that I was wearing new pyjamas. I also showed him my bites that had appeared that morning as a result of scratching all night. He said that they were old marks! Whaaat?! I expected some compensation, even a discount off breakfast, I would have been happy with that. But to have absolutely nothing but excuses and insulting comments made the whole stay in Amsterdam very disappointing. They advertise that the rooms are normally 400 euro and discounted to 160 euro but the rooms are rubbish and definitely not worth 400. This is simply a ploy to make people think they are getting a bargain. It certainly fooled me. I do not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: dawn09liverpool
Reviews.Content: Location was wonderful with nice veiws of the canals and not far from Dam Square which is a lovely place. However the staff at the hotel were not helpful and the food service was awful we ordered room service one night and it came stone cold so sent it back and they still charged us for the meals . Also we did not get told when booking this holiday that we needed to pay a 50 euro deposit which you should get back when going home but you also have to pay 25 euros city tax out of your deposit which I didn't understand

Reviews.Title: “nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: DostiAli
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear over new years 2008. excellent location for access to most of the tourist things in amsterdam. its about 20 mins walk from the train station so if you are dragging a lot of luggage maybe a taxi is in order. the rooms are pretty standard for a hotel, has all the standard facilities you would want. the hotel staff were very accomadating as i messed up one of the room reservations, the receptionist was more than happy to honour what i thought i had booked for the same price. the layout of the hotel is a bit of a maze but adds to the charm.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM LIKE AN OVEN”
Reviews.Author: neofytos
Reviews.Content: ROOM WAS BAKING due to hot water pipes running through the room, it was so hot I was sweating so opened the windows and had a noise group of people staying in a room opposite making AN ABSOLUTE RACKET till 04:30am, the noise is not the hotel's fault but the reason for me having to open the windows WAS. I woke up very hot and thirsty at 23:50 and asked the person on reception if I can buy a bottle of water from the bar, which was directly opposite reception, despite there being no other customers to deal with, the answer was "no, the bar closes at 11pm", which I found very dissapointing. Worse still was he neglected to say there was a vending machine in the breakfast area, which I noticed the next morning. The receptionist during the day (young lady) was very helpful, the night receptionist person was very unhelpful and made no effort at all to help or show any endeavour. I was there late September, DONT EVEN THINK OF STAYING HERE IN THE SUMMER WITH THE ADDED HEAT. JUST DONT!!!!! Otherwise, the bed was OK (just) quite springy and old. Normal hotel TV channels. Old decor but ok. Clean enough. Breakfast was ok but will not meet most people's expectations due to choice. Bath was fine but toilet has very little space, Im 5 '9, 65Kg and was ok but if youre on the large side you WILL NOT BE ABLE TO USE THE TOILET as its between the wall and bath. Everything else ok, but the negatives were in just too important areas. Mainly the bread oven like room and old bed matress.

Reviews.Title: “Would definatly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: bumhug501
Reviews.Content: Me an my partner stayed here for a few nights not long ago. When we booked, the website stated "standard double/twin room". We are aware that usually this means that you end up with two twin beds just pushed togather but we were pleasently surprised to find a very large double. In fact i would have said it was more like king size! Fantastic! Also very very comfortable! The lady at reception told us we were in room 25 which is "a very nice room". This room was great! High ceilings, tall windows, chandelier etc. all very grand, perhaps a little too grand for us but for what we paid we were very happy with it. The location of this hotel is great - on a nice quiet canal but only a 5 minute wak from Dam square, brilliant for shops and restaurants. the ony thing we felt was missing was a mini bar in the room! maybe we i'm being a little picky though! we didn't really mind using the vending machine under reception! All in all a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gonetravellin00
Reviews.Content: Great location just off Dam square, there are lots of shops, restaurants & tram stops all within easy walking distance. The room was a comfortable size but had twin beds, this is very common & we usually just push them together but this room had a table fixed between the beds! i explained the situation to a member of staff, unfortunately they couldnt do anything that evening but the following day we were moved to a very big room with a double bed & amazing canal veiw, it was very nice. I have been to amsterdam many times & this was my second stay at the Rembrandt, in my opinion this is a very good 3* hotel compared with many others in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sammydev
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and plenty large enough. They were cleaned every day, linen and towels changed. Breakfast catered for all tastes and staff again were helpful and polite. Very good location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and stinky..bad service”
Reviews.Author: gurnlites
Reviews.Content: I travel much and am quite aware that euro hotels are different than other places .But this is just a neglected facility and where they could make up for it a bit in service...they don't. No help with luggage,..badly informed front desk staff, and slow to ask if you need anything. also, beware, steps at the entrance, and three more sets up stairs on the way to my room, not good if youve got heavy luggage(luckily I didn't). Anyway, won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: nattie101
Reviews.Content: First time in Europe - good size room and bathroom, clean, lots of light, comfy bed what more could you want! Would stay again if went back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: pr0fumo
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, found it really quite easily. We arrived into the centre of amsterdam by train and walked to the hotel. The staff were friendly, the reception area was nice and clean and bright, and the rooms were too. They were very clean, and the bathroom was spotless. All in all, this place was fine, it really did the trick. If i went back to amsterdam, i would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located quiet good value”
Reviews.Author: topshamtim
Reviews.Content: We booked through the internet from Copenhagen, arrived from the overnight train. Our rooms were ready and available. They were very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms had powerful showers and a bath. Room size was adequate but the price was good. The promised early morning taxi for the airport arrived on time. This is in a quiet location near the main attractions and facilities, easy to get to from the central station and move around from here.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: amp0
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from staying one night at the Rembrand Hotel. We chose this hotel because of the good location and the reviews which were quite good so we were expecting a good value for our money. The hotel it is in need of a good renovation, the room we were given: 215 - was tiny - and I mean really tiny - we live in Holland and we are used to small rooms but this one was ridiculously small, we went back to the front desk and we got it changed for a different one overlooking to a pretty dirty interior patio. The room did not feel very clean, and the breakfast really basic - not worth paying 8 euros for it, there are plenty of nice little bakeries around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: CroydonDiva
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location of this hotel. Views from front and back of hotel over canals, so you'd have to be going some to get a room without an amazing view. Breakfast was great value - all you can eat including cheese, cold meats, breads, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, little fluffy pancake things, beans, salad, tea, coffee, cereal, fruit juice, etc. and the selection changes slightly every day to stop you getting bored. As eating out in Amsterdam is generally very dear, I'd recommend the hotel breakfast as a great start to the day. The staff were great. We arrived far too early to check in, but they took our luggage so we could go and explore without lugging bags around. Also, when it came to check out, although the check out times should start at 7am, we had an early flight and Reception were happy to arrange to check us out at 4.30am! And they booked our taxi to take us to the airport. We booked through Lastminute.com so don't know the exact price we paid, but it was definitely value for money overall. Twin room, canal view, warm room, and when it got a bit stuffy we could open the windows to air the room, which was lovely. The beds were really soft, and spare blankets and pillows are provided if you need them. The bathroom was really clean, with a great powerful shower and bath. It did get a bit damp because the extractor fan didn't seem to be working(?) but that was easily solved by leaving the door open. In the UK, we are used to even the most basic hotels having tea and coffee making facilities in the room, so I was disappointed not to have that as standard, but it didn't ruin my holiday experience! The maid service is exactly what you want - efficient and invisible. We never saw our maid, but the room was always spotless by the time we nipped back for an afternoon nap! Not only would we recommend this hotel to a friend, but we'd also look to book in again ourselves when we come back to Amsterdam in future...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ukroll
Reviews.Content: Very good for Dam Square, Anne Frank house and Westerkirk all only 10 min walk. We had a canal facing room which could be a bit noisy, but after walking round the city all day, didn't stop us from sleeping! Advise doing both day and night canal trips to get the best of both. If going to Keukenhof do the ALL day trip as you will need it, we booked from UK, noticed that in Amsterdam a lot of the trips there were only advertised as 1/2 day ones. We did have to pay a 50 euro deposit at the hotel when we checked in, but that was returned in full and we didn't have to pay the city tax (don't know if that was because we checked out very early in the morning)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday in wonderful country with fantastic friends”
Reviews.Author: NettyWYorks
Reviews.Content: Booked through easy book . com but the booking got a little confusing when 2 people cancelled. Arrived at the hotel after an earl y flight and explained to the receptionist that we were a bed short on the booking but she said it would be ok , on returning to the hotel at the appropriate time a different receptionist was quite vehement about the error and was going to charge an extra 150 Euros for 3 nights.But the manager passed by and sorted it out for us , made us complementary tea and made sure we had our rooms on time. We throughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel .It has clean rooms and a pleasant convenient location just one of the rooms seemed a bit noisy and warm but i would definately stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “What a GOOD choice!”
Reviews.Author: filemanLancasterUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent central canal-side location, just a very short walk to dam square - the centre of activity. Service very friendly throughout and cleanliness seems paramount. Room afforded plenty of space if a little basic (we didn't have a view) but all facilities fine. Breakfast (self serve) was certainly more than adequate with plenty of hot & cold food without restriction on amount! The surrounding area has plenty of different little shops to explore with eclectic tastes but watch out for the ubiquitous cyclists - at least they generally had the wit to ring their bells to warn you of their speedy arrival (from apparently) all directions! Liked? - All of it. Disliked? Canâ€™t really answer this one; nothing to say apart from keeping your wits about you when potential surcharges (city tax and breakfast charges) are mentioned - or subtly requested. We had booked with a travel company that included B & B and were prepared to pay the obligatory 'city tax' i.e. 5% of the accommodation charges but the final bill was discharged without any extras - perhaps we were, as ever very friendly in our approach and that helped? Thoroughly recommended for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware in this hotel! They cheat in reception.”
Reviews.Author: ElgaJ
Reviews.Content: When I checked-in they collected 50 EUR deposit and I almost forgot about that when I checked out and of course nobody in reception reminded me about that. However when I asked back my deposit girl in reception hesitated to return it and then started to talk about city taxes and clean streets which was evaluated for 12 EUR. I was in a hurry to airport so I didn't start to argue and asked back my 38 Eur but they didn't got any change for that and finally I got 30 Eur. I checked my reservation afterward and of course ALL taxes were included. I will never stay in this hotel again. If this manager of this hotel is reading this I advice you to put eye on the girl who worked on April 21 around 10:00.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but average”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED99
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the wife for three nights at the Rembrandt Classic ( formerly Rembrandt Centrum ) during a visit to Amsterdam and specifically the bulb fields at Keukenhof which are spectacular. Check in was very efficient and although we were early only had to wait a few minutes for a room of our choice. Room though small was clean, comfortable and adequate for our needs. There was more outside noise during the night than we anticipated but this was my fault for requesting a canal view at the front which was only on the first floor. Reception staff were tremendously helpful throughout the stay even allowing me to use the reception computer in a vain attempt to check in our return flight on line. ( Does anyone else have repeated problems accessing the KLM website when abroad? ). The hotel is located in a pleasant residential area alongside a canal on Herengracht just minutes from Dam Square. Earlier reviews seem very mixed but then people have different standards. The hotel interior is looking tired and dated and in need of a major re-decoration and some new room curtains. Some minor irritations included the shower head fixed too low ( I am only 6ft tall) and a towel rail fitted above one end of the bath where you can hit your head when showering. We strongly disagree with earlier positive reviews about breakfast which we found to be mediocre and the choice of items very average. On our first two mornings we went down for 7.00am the official opening time and some items including fresh coffee had not been put out. Hot drinks are from a machine which I detest and causes queues when busy. On our last morning we went later and got the last clean table. Subsequently people were arriving to tables cluttered with crockery and debris and staff made no attempt to set clean tables unless specifically asked to do so. A table near us remained uncleared for the enitire duration of breakfast. We love Amsterdam but it is currently expensive for UK visitors. Great for walking and exploring, people very friendly and helpful and lots to do. It is a short season but Keukenhof is wonderful ( go by train and bus ) and if you like Indonesian cuisine go to the "Antelope and Tiger" ( reception will give you directions ). In summary the hotel was adequate for our needs but there is not sufficient attention to getting the basics right and it needs a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Four Recommends Rembrandt Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosieleeBristol
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam with husband and close friends. Flew Easyjet and booked hotel through Easyjet website. As it was only a 3 night stay we were not too worried about where to stay as long as cheap and cheerful. We definately came up trumps. There is nothing bad to say about this hotel whatsoever. Breakfast was excellent, and so much choice, lots of fruit, even bacon and scrambled eggs. All linen was spotless, pure white towels, very spacious rooms overlooking the canal, very quiet location but only a 5 minute walk to Dam Square, Anne Frank House and a Canal Bus Stop. The Canal hop and off bus is a must. Takes you to all the attractions and a very good commentary on the way. Once you buy your ticket it last until 12 noon the following day, well worth it. We had to take a trip into the Red Light District as did most tourists. As a female I have to say I did not feel threatened and saw no bad behaviour. Another must trip is the Henniken Experience. It cost about 15 Euros each but it is a fun trip with a couple of free samples of Henniken. You can email videos of yourself to friends singing or just a happy wish you were here video. Great fun!! Amsterdam is very expensive so make sure you are prepared to spend a little - shops are the same as almost everywhere, but hopefully if you are on a short trip the attractions will keep you busy. Will definately go back, perhaps early Summer whereby you could sit outside the bars and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean - good for the price you're paying”
Reviews.Author: becstravels
Reviews.Content: Location: for the price you pay, the location is great. Approx 5 minute walk from Central station, close enough to the Anne Frank House & the canal boat stop there. Cleanliness: beds were extremely clean, so were the bathrooms. Unfortunately, most mornings the bathroom greeted us with really bad smell but we realised this was coming from the drains - you just need to open the windows but that was a real shame. I don't think this can be helped by the hotel though, i hear that is a sewer/drainage issue in Amsterdam. Otherwise, cleaner does a great job every day. Service: Service was decent. We requested a double room if possible (had booked a twin) and although they didnt have a double, they pushed two single beds together for us which is the best they could do. Overall, it is great value for money as other hotels with that location that are clean could command much more. Sure this hotel looks a bit older on the inside and isn't as flash but if you jsut need a clean place to sleep for a decent price in a good location, i would recommend it to other travellers! Note wi-fi was essential for us and it was very expensive here. It was 6 euro for 60 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, unhelpful & unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: Young_Aussie_couple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rembrandt Classic Hotel for 3 nights midweek at the beginning of March. The room was nice, but small. The bathroom was probably the cleanest we have ever had in all our travels throughout Africa & Europe. The room walls seemed very thin, as we could hear the people in the next room as well as across the corridor having a conversation. We could also hear pigeon outside our room (we over looked a courtyard) that have settled on nearly all of the window sills. The biggest problem we had was upon arrival we were told our breakfast was included, so we enjoyed 3 breakfasts, upon check out, we were told it wasnt included and that the person who checked us in had made a mistake BUT they still wanted us to pay the Â£8.50 each per breakfast for the 3 days, even though it was their mistake. The person in reception than brought up how we had paid a cheaper room rate-which is totally irrelevant! We asked to speak to the manager, who then insinuated that WE had written on our check in card that our breakfast was included - basically calling us liars! I WOULD NOT recommend this hotel, as the staff were very unprofessional and not helpful with our inquiries about where to eat etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap central located basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdchess
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room for a couple of nights. Check in was friendly and the location is really good. Easy walking distance to most places and close to trams/buses for others. Room was small but clean. It was on the ground floor just off reception which was a bit weird. Indeed there are two rooms which are basically located at the corner of the reception area! Would not have wanted one of these. However, I had no problems with noise during my stay. Everything in the room worked fine and there is even BBC 1/BBC 2 on the TV! The room rate I got was less than 50 euros which was cheap. Breakfast was 8.50 euro extra for a decent buffet spread inc eggs and bacon. They have a luggage room also. Because of the cheap rates and being amsterdam there were quite a few young people around partying but they caused me no problems. Overall for the price it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, Good location”
Reviews.Author: supacoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Anne Frank house and is also an easy walk to the Red Light district and the Leidesplein area (even in the cold!). We booked a room for four and had two double beds in one large room, with a sitting area and small table/chairs and couch. The shower was nice, but did have quite a lot of mildew on the walls. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, but the bar area was decent, and the common areas are all well kept. Our big "find" was the vending machine selling beer, which we thought was very nice. This hotel would be quite difficult for anyone with disabilities to maneuver around, with lots of steps on all floors. Overall, good location, decent price, not the most updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable "no frills" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BT55
Reviews.Content: Booked this last minute through laterooms.com and paid â‚¬84 inc. tax for a double room. Arrived at a busy time of the day (1pm) with people checking in and out all at the same time. Had booked a twin because no double was listed on the booking form, but the very busy receptionist offered us a double anyway, which was good. Room was a small double overlooking the back of the hotel - clean but fine for what we wanted. Unfortunately, there is not much in the way of sound-proofing and we were awoken to the sound of someone throwing up continuously and very noisily, which wasn't pleasant! Location is brilliant - by an attractive canal and close to the town centre and Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel very central”
Reviews.Author: sparkydeaves
Reviews.Content: The Rembrandt Classic is a typical 3 star Amsterdam hotel, basic and comfortable donâ€™t not expect and frills even though the hotel likes to think it worth more than 3* by the fancy facade. Sitting just behind Dam tract its far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist streets, and only 5 mins walk away from it all. The photos on the hotel guides and website are a bit misleading but all beds were clean, room a good size and TV has about 12+ English channels including (BBC 1 &2). The only criticism I would have is that it wouldn't break the bank for the hotel to buy some kettles and cup so you could have a coffee or tea!!!! Having said that, as a well travelled visitor to Amsterdam for the price compared to the location you canâ€™t do much better. Would probably be booking to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Rembrandt”
Reviews.Author: tripaholic-rio
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Rembrandt for 5 nights on April 2007, and the experience was really wonderful. We had tremendous luck regarding the weather - sunny most of the time, and it didn't rain for the our whole stay. The hotel was extremely well situated, a few block from the Dam in one direction and from Anne Frank's house in the other. You can also walk to central station from there, though it would be like a 15/20 minute walk. It was a really nice place, quiet at night and a few steps from the crowds during the day, and our room faced the channel (ask for it !). Nice rooms (fair size), pretty clean and a very good breakfast, plus a really great staff. I will come back to Amsterdam (love that city!), and definetely will stay on the Rembrandt again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: fronya
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a godsend to stay at, although it wasn't the easiest hotel to get to via the tram (we parked at one of the autoparkades by the Stadium). A taxi can get you to the front door, however. We shared a large room with another couple and the room was spectacularly large, the beds were wonderfully comfortable and we had a lovely view of the canals in front. The room ended up being quite affordable ($125 per night, per couple) but we booked through hotels.ca. This location is wonderfully central to much that you would want to do in Amsterdam and we cannot recommend this place more. The staff were very courteous and knowledgeable. Some of the floors, however, can be difficult to navigate for the elderly or the disabled since there are many levels and stairs throughout, so if this is a concern, please be careful about which room you get. The breakfast, however, is way too expensive but there are some decent bistros nearby (though even these can be tricky to find).

Reviews.Title: “Brill stay !”
Reviews.Author: r4pbp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, fantastic stay, hotel was clean and the staff more than helpful. The room was adequate not over large but fine loads of hot water fantastic baths every night which is essential because the amount of walking during the day one needs a hot bath at night. The room was very clean and modern only thing missing a kettle but that's not unusual on the continent. This hotel is in a fantastic location just right as Amsterdam is a place for walking. Had a great time and would really recommend this hotel, pity the bar closes at 10.30 ! not to worry so many bars nearby. Amsterdam is certainly worth the trip a truly beautiful chilled out city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vg30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Rembrandt Centrum last March. The location is great. Near Dam Square and not far from the Centraal Station. Our room was large, clean and with view to a canal. The people at reception were friendly and always ready to give infomations about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base of Operations”
Reviews.Author: robbuaa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew into the Amsterdam Airport and took the train into the Central Station. From there, it took about 15 minutes to walk to the Hotel. We could've taken the bus, but we figured we'd be able to take in more of the atmosphere by walking. Very easy to find. Check in was smooth. Everyone spoke excellent English. Front desk staff was very friendly and courteous. Upon bumping into them later, they remembered my name. Asked for a room with a view and got one. Room had a faint bit of smoke but not like a Motel 6 or anything like that. Very high ceiling, which made the room seem a lot bigger. But it was a decent size in its own right. Our room was on the ground floor and right above the back door, so when the staff went out for breaks, we'd get loud conversation and smoke (when our windows were open). Granted, it only happened in the late mornings and afternoons and never at night. We only noticed it when we slept in or when we came back to the hotel for an afternoon nap. Didn't have the hotel breakfast, but there's a nice organic restaurant a block or two south of here. One of the other reviewers mentioned it. Forgot the name, but it's quite good. Try the omelette. And even when they were closed, we headed west and found a pub-like place that had great food despite looking a bit dark. Location is excellent. On a quiet street but extremely close to Dam Square. The Anne Frank house and Westkirk are also within close striking distance. We just walked everywhere, as central Amsterdam is quite compact. If we can find a good deal online again like we did this time, we'd definitely stay here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and again location+value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ronen-Zeus
Reviews.Content: My second time in Amsterdam (first one was 15 years ago) and both times stayed at the "Rembrandt Centrum", difference was all for better, this time I ordered single room, and got double room at the same price, asked for "canal view" and got it, in general room was very clean, cleaned every day , polite staff and answered the need of staying in Amsterdam at a centrally located hotel. two blocks from Dam square and yet quiet street. I payed about 130 $ per night and it deffinetlly justifies the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GladKent_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Rembrandt and found it to be comfortable and clean and in a fantastic location. It was quietly situated but within easy reach of everything we needed. Our rate included breakfast and a boat trip and staff were friendly and helpful. The room wasn't huge but for a 3* hotel in a central location it was great. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Be happy to go there again”
Reviews.Author: Gavin18
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel in heart of Amsterdam. Bit of a mix up when checking in which needed sorted out, got a double rather than a twin, otherwise no problems. Staying room only although did try breakfast one morning, its okay but you can find better breakfast outside once you know your way around. Quite busy, everytime we went past recepotion someone was either checking in or checking out. No problems keeping our bags on day of departure after we had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “a good location”
Reviews.Author: geezerEngland
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel bank holiday weekend.the location is very good and local to all attractions.if you get room 423 make sure you change as this is in the roof and being tall i had no chance in the shower or entering the room door.we was changed after first night to a great room on the ground floor,the hotel staff were very helpful. have visited amsterdam many times but as i found this year it is like everything VERY EXPENSIVE!! ps the sweets on reception are a winner after visiting coffee shops :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but ...”
Reviews.Author: critaly
Reviews.Content: Nice stay ,wonderful location and very kind staff but the rooms are not so large and beautiful as those you can see on the hotel website. The rooms on the hotel homepage have nothing to do with the real rooms I saw .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for amsterdam away from the masses of louts”
Reviews.Author: thebeaurivage
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel on herengracht which means you are based on "the nine streets". If you want a nice clean comfortable hotel away from the masses and louts around dam square this is one for you. The area is much more atmospheric than that area and cleaner and more peaceful with plenty of lovely restaurants and funky bars.It is on the edge of the jordaan which is the nicest part of the city.There are also lots of vintage clothes stores and independent boutigues and shoe shops The hotel is clean and has everything you need ( but no internet room/cafe if you want to pre check in on line) it is not glamourous or anything but the rooms are a good size for amsterdam where the hotel rooms as a rule are small. The bathroom was spotless as was the bedlinen and towels etc. We were given the canal view we asked for and we found the staff helpful and friendly. This is a non smoking hotel in line with EU Law so the smoking smell mentioned by another reviewer is not an issue any longer. They will also lend you an umbrella if it is raining which is nice. I would not bother with breakfast in the hotel as there are plenty of cafes nearby check out teh lovely Pancakes! pancake house which is on Berenstraad only a 5-10 minute walk away instead. You can book on their own website and this was a lower price as the prices I found with the usual internet providers so it is worth checking out their own website to see what price they are offering All in all I would really recommend this hotel for location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: David-Sydney_Aust
Reviews.Content: In the heart of it in old Amsterdam. We walked everywhere as there was no travelling but it was also very quiet. We got a cheap deal for 99 Euros so we weren't in the best room. Out the back overlooking the coutryard. However the room was clean and basic. Staff were friendly. Nice old building with huge beam a foot thick. Breakfast was expensive and we found it better to eat at the little cafes (the only drawback is lots of places didn't open until 11am). No fridge so we couldn't eat our own basic meals but this wasn't a huge drama. Cheap wireless internet for us to connect to so we could continue running our business. We were very happy with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Jensy25
Reviews.Content: I took my young family to visit Amsterdam, a place I used to live pre-children. From past experience, I've known Amsterdam to be quite expensive especially true for hotels. Hotel Rembrandt Centrum is not different, although it does offer better value for money than the rest of the hotels in the same star bracket. The location is better too. Close enough to be part of the action but in a quiet enough locale to skip the noise and traffic. I booked a quadruple room and it was more than spacious enough to fit two adults and three young children. The bonus was the lovely view onto Singel. This is typically a three star hotel so don't expect too much in the way of room decor or standard. The staff were extremely friendly and an asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent Location”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyPat
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam last week with my boyfriend, and we wanted some where safe and centerally located to stay and at a reasonable price! â‚¬178 for 2 nights is a great deal for a 3 star hotel, considering the price of some dodgy hostels! The hotel is about 15 min walk from central station take a taxi for â‚¬10! Dam Square, Madame Tusads, Red light district are all only less than a 5 min walk away. The hotel is safe & clean, rooms are decent sized with all mod cons, if you are just looking for some where clean, central and rather cheap this is the place! Staff are helpful and friendly! No air con in rooms is a disadvantage, we had to keep window wide open 24hrs, as room was so warm! Weird smell in some corridors! But i would recommend this place & would stay ere again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crooks
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this hotel for two nights we arrived at 1pm and were checked in quickly and efficiently. Our room was on the first floor with three large windows overlooking the canal. It was a lovely large light room with two single beds and a double sofa bed. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable. We rang reception for tea and coffee and a tray was brought to our room within minutes. The breakfast was amazing, cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurt, toast, fresh coffee and all the usual cooked english breakfast items. It was as good as any 4star hotel. The staff were all polite and smiling and the public rooms were spick and span. You must visit a pancake house and hire a bike, quite an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: hexuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty easy to find and a quick walk from the tram stop a couple of streets away. When we arrived the staff were very helpful, and spoke excellent English. We had booked a room for 3 with a canal view but were told that unfortunately they only had a ground floor triple room without the view. This turned out to be fine, we had a view of the courtyard (someone else described this as prison-like) but that depends on your point of view - the room was light enough and we didn't spend time looking out the window. The room was lovely, a good size for a triple with 3 single beds, average sized bathroom (with bath not just a shower), desk, table and chairs, hairdryer, etc. Our weekend stay was great and the hotel is in the perfect location for exploring all aspects of Amsterdam, you are literally within walking distance of everything, there are some nice little shops nearby, good selection of restaurants a couple of canals away and 5 mins from Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “It was different”
Reviews.Author: DarylHeadley
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a through lastminute.com It was one of those secret stays where you never get to see the name of the hotel until you've paid in full. So having taken the plunge we looked online to check out the hotel. We were quite impressed with the location and appearance of the rooms. But on arrival we were surprised to see that the photos online were nothing compared with that in real life. If you're a non-smoker I wouldn't reccomend this hotel as the lobby stinks of smoke coming from the lounge area. The rooms are tiny and from what I've read from other reviews, I see the dodgy central heating in the bathroom will never work. The walls are very thin and our hotel view was just like that of a prison. But there were good things about this hotel. The staff were very helpful. The bathroom was so clean you could of eaten your dinner off it. Shame about the poor plumbing works. ie no cold water. We noticed that it costs 600 euros per night if you walked in and asked for a room. If you want 4 or 5 star hotel, I suggest you stay in Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: tess1562
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 2 night stay in the Rembrandt Centrum and it was a very pleasant stay we booked a triple room with two double beds and was given room 326 which faced the canal and was a very good size with a sofa bed as well as the two doubles, our radiator wasnt working and we were offered an alternative room or an electric heater, after seeing the alternative room we decided on the heater, as the room was in the attic of the hotel with very little head height and not acceptable if you happen to be taller than 5'8" (room 422), staff were friendly and helpful and as mentioned in other reviews the location is very good only minutes from the hussle and bussle but such a nice quiet street. We booked a non smoking room but it is obvious that guests flount the rules as there was a smell of smoke in our room and some burns to the carpet. The website we booked through advertised tea and coffee making facilities, they are available but at a cost of 5 euros a day. I would have no hesitation of recommending this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just the job!”
Reviews.Author: scunnybunny78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rembrandt Centrum for 4 nights and it suited my needs perfectly. The room was absolutely spotless and everything was in working order. The staff were very efficient, helpful and polite. The hotel is in the perfect location for sightseeing (about 3 mins walk from Dam square) and over looks the Herengracht (when you open the curtains in the morning it is a most beautiful sight!) If you want 5* luxury then this hotel is not for you (but then you wouldn't be looking at this review would you?) if what you want is a well-run good, clean, honest hotel in stunning surroundings then press the "book now" button, trust me you'll not do better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCitybreaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter at this hotel for a short city break in Feb 08. It is a great location about a 3 minute walk from Dam Square. We felt very safe even walking back at night, The hotel was clean and friendly and our room was fine not at all small as others have said. The breakfast was excellent and you could even have cooked if you wanted. There was a big selection of breads,cheese, cereals, juice, and fresh fruit and yoghurts. We would definately recommend it and would stay again. Eat at the argentinian restaurant as you walk to Dam Square best steak I've ever had and really friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value and Almost Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: norwayusa1
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. I researched and researched to find the best deal. I succeeded with the help of this hotel and a European internet booking company. You have to plan when you are going, since I do understand that the rates are typically much higher. I certainly cannot complain about the hotel's holiday rate. The location is superb. It is a block from one of my favorite hotels in Amsterdam and a fraction of the price. There are nice loft-like hotels that can look out onto the canal. Based on the view that our room had, we just wanted to stay and relax in our hotel after a long flight. I will say that there are definitely ways to save in getting to the hotel. First, you can take the train from Schiphol to Central Station. From there, you can take the 1,2, or 5 tram, and you will be about 3 blocks from the hotel. I was very impressed with the local transportation. Be aware that for early morning flights, you may have to walk to the Central Station. The tram does not go out before 6 am. If you do go out, go in groups of 2 or more. It is not the safest to be out in the early morning hours. The police patrol the area, but that may not always be enough. Also, it is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel to the train station. Seeing as there was so much savings and excellent accomodations, why would it not be five stars? There were two things that caused my husband and I to give it 4 stars. There are no alarm clocks and hair dryers in the rooms. Honestly, that seems fairly minimal until you take into effect - jet lag and a morning flight to our final destination. Other suggestions for improvements might be: air conditioning during the summer, affordable breakfast, more info about internet capabilities (TMobile Hot Spot) and wake up calls, and finally, better ways to keep out the colder draft. All in all, I am very impressed. The service is very good. Hopefully, next time I can give it the powerful 5 stars. Until then, I would highly recommend it. It is not luxury, but it is definitely worthwhile. Have fun in Amsterdam! The canal, inexpensive eateries, wonderful archetecture, and museums make it a place to remember. You'll be happy to visit Rembrandt Centrum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: just_a_phase_uk
Reviews.Content: The Rembrandt is a great little hotel situated only 5 mins away from Dam Sq. The rooms on the front have a nice canal view and overall the hotel is in very good condition. We stayed for 5 nights with a canal view room. The hotel was within walking distance of all the major attractions, with Anne Frankâ€™s house only a couple of minutes walk away. The room was spacious and modern and was also very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anybody that wants to explore Amsterdam by foot.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't like cigarette smoke, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: rocketstef
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Room and bathroom extremely clean. Breakfast was so-so. Reasonably priced. Friendly and helpful employees. Our big complaint was the smoking. There is a sitting room next to the front entrance, and the front desk is located here as well. People (including the chain-smoking desk clerks) regularly smoked in this room. All smoke wafted straight up the stairs to the guest rooms. Our room constantly smelled (day and night). It really drove us crazy. If you are a smoker, this is a great hotel. If you don't like smoke, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great loation but overpriced for quality”
Reviews.Author: jennicole20
Reviews.Content: Overall, our experience at this hotel was positive. The reception staff was friendly and helpful -- they let us store our bags a few hours before checkin because the room wasn't ready. We reserved a triple room which was very large. The room was very clean although barely decorated and on the dated side. The best feature of the hotel was the location right off of Dam Square. Everything was in walking distance which was perfect. My biggest disappointment for the stay was getting a room without a view as this was one of the main reasons I picked this hotel over others. The bathroom was a bit problematic as the ceiling in the shower was very low and quite moldy. My husband and brother had a hard time washing their hair without bumping the moldy ceiling - yuck! also, the bathroom was extremely small so anything on the sink vanity was completely soaked because the shower curtain didn't really do the trick (the vanity light less than 6 inches from the shower also made me a bit nervous as it got pretty wet.) Our showerhead was also broken and was held up by a paperclip. Overall, the location of the hotel was good but I think I could have found a much better value elsewhere -- either better quality for the money or the same quality for less money. I do not think I'll return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, Very clean, Quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: maglite
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as a Flight/Hotel package through Easyjet. Book-in was quick and efficient. The room was clean and neat with extra bedclothes in the wardrobe. The bathroom, however, needed a little bit of attention. Although the room was spotlessly clean, the shower-head had only two positions- straight up or forty-five degrees down. When you turned the taps from "tap" to "shower" position, water would flow from where the hose connected to the tap block, resulting in water running along the top edge of the bath onto the floor. Once you jammed the shower-head in the upright position and put a flannel adjacent to the taps to divert the leaking water back into the bath, it wasn't so bad....so long as you stood halfway along the bath so that the spray actually hit you. Both these faults could have been fixed in two minutes by someone armed with a screwdriver and a molegrip....maybe next time. The one thing which I missed was the means to make a cup of coffee or tea ( as has been mentioned ) although the room did have a trouser-press!! Why? I've never used a trouser-press in my life and folks, I can honestly say, I never will. We didn't have the buffet breakfast in the hotel, but from what I saw gawking in the window from the street, it looked OK ...fruit, cold meats, cereals, juice etc The "Bar" is the foyer of the hotel with a few tables where you can get a drink or a coffee when you return from your exploring, but it's not a "lively-hotel-bar" in that sense, in fact it's so quiet we usually had to step to the reception to ask for service. That said, the hotel is in a really great location - just a few minutes walk from Dam Square and many restaurants and cafÃ©s. The staff are very helpful and polite and as I said everything was spotlessly clean. I would have no hesitation in staying at the Rembrandt again. PS Loose the trouser-press, supply a tea tray

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: P&J-7
Reviews.Content: Having booked with Last Minute.com we were a little apprehensive as to what to expect. We flew with KLM - really impressed with the overall service - on the ground and in the air. The hotel is basic but very clean and overlooks a canal. Decided not to go for the breakfast in the hotel but had room service a few times and that was fine. We used the train from the airport to the hotel - both times - the train was on the platform and straight through - it takes approx. 20 minutes - train fare 16 euros return for two people - a bargain! From the station, we took a taxi - a little expensive for such a short journey - 1.9kms - charged 12 euros going to hotel and 10 euros back to the station. The location of the hotel was good if you don't mind walking - only minutes away from the main Dam square, Anne Franks House, Museums and Boat Trips. Eating out is about the same price as in the UK - don't expect a cheap meal out and you won't be disappointed afterall it is a city. The only thing I would say is that if you like a cup of tea or coffee, there are no facilities in the room. You can buy them at the bar or order in your room up until 10.30pm. Overall, a good city break for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely clean hotel - recommended to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Franble
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in the Rembrandt Centrum and absolutely loved it! Took a chance on lastminute.com by booking a "Top Secret Hotel" and ended up in this 3 star delight, right on the Herrengracht Canal and about a 10 minute stroll away from Dam Square! Fab! Hotel is a typical 3 star really - very clean, very helpful staff and porters, nice breakfast buffet and you can book excursions at reception too. Rooms are basic, very clean with good showers and comfy beds... Location is perfect! Away from any noisy roads set right on the front of the canal and close to all the major attractions! Would recommend to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Reeky, small, noisy, stiflingly hot... urgh.”
Reviews.Author: dygoje
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on 23rd of August, reading reviews we hoped to find a compact small room close to the centre of town. What we got was excellent in terms of location but failed misrably on all other civilized means of measure. We booked a double room and were given a twin, I thought since we had arrived at around 2pm this could be remedied however the ineptitude of the hotel's spaced out staff began to prevail, we heard in some stoned out tones that it was our fault for booking it wrong (we later checked, no it was the hotel in error, shock) and we would have to wait until the next day... okay, not so bad. Since it was toasty out, and no air-con in the rooms (yep, a misnomer in the hotel details advertise(d)) we opened the window to what seemed like the construction of a world class sporting arena, this swapped over into screaming and sustained argument between dodgier aspects of the community at around 10.30pm till late. We thought the next day would be better, shock horror it got worse. The only double room available was next to reception, meaning not only did we have the construction crews and skanky aspects to listen to we were also now on the recieivng end of drunken weekenders remote vitriol to one another. The double bed is pushed aside a wall meaning some late night fumbling (heh heh) - only thing is the only fumble is a kick when the lavvy's needed! The third day we fumbled our way out of the place, I took a lot of convincing not to leave some good acts of "sabotage" in the room by my better half, and we checked into the Grand Hotel (Grand Sofitel). Not cheap by any means but sooooo comfortable, since the room they were going to give us was occupied so a free upgrade to a suite and some free booze certainly cheered us up. The only thing going for the Rembrandt is the TV channel choice is good (helps drown out the screaming - I wondered at one point if it was the other inmates) but the screen makes matchboxes look huge. And it reeked.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DarrenGarside
Reviews.Content: Picked this up as a lastminute.com mystery room. Having checked out where this was on the web we were quite sure about what we were getting. Comfortable, well-specified but no breakfast. Certainly no problems or issues. Unfortunately this is retrospective review as we visited six months ago but we were quite happy with our stay and very pleased with the level of cleanliness and noise which are our main criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHALKIE-7
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel 20th July 2007 in a double room with breakfast. The room was 111 and was adequate for our needs, although the room could be considered small as the double bed was against the wall at one side and the bathroom was a bit tight - but how long do you spend in your room? However the room and bathroom were very clean and towels changed each day. Good TV , but no tea and coffee making facilities but not a real problem as there are plenty of bars and coffee shops nearby. Breakfast was very good with a large selection of hot and cold foods, in a lovely sunny room overlooking the canal, with excellent service from the staff. The hotel reception staff were also very good and very helpful booking trips, and providing directions. The hotel is in a very good location, near to Dam Square, Anne Franks House, Canal Boat Trips, Red Light District and the main shops. There may be cheaper hotels but this hotel has LOCATION LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: lauranmat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice basic quality hotel. the location was lovely once you found it (not right in the middle of everything, but a short walk away). When i booked i had booked a twin room but added a note to the booking to ask if i could have a double, this was noted and we were given a double room. The bathroom was a nice size and the room was non smoking, also as i had requested. We hadn;t booked breakfast with our room so i can;t comment on the food. however the bar was excellent, even though it didn;t open very late. We stayed in room 111 and the only downside was that there's a hot pipe that runs through the room which always seemed to be on. although the entral heating was switched off. it felt like it was on full 24/7 and this was hard work, expecially when the july nights were warm. on the first morning i got a shower which was gorgeous and powerful, but the shower fell off the wall. however, as soon as i notified reception this was fixed. all in all a good hotel and i would definitely stay again, providing it wasnt in room 111!!

Reviews.Title: “service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: pooroldpom
Reviews.Content: no problems here. staff very helpfull and would offer and advice you needed..rooms very clean and tidy tea and coffee anytime in bar was a godsend. drinks costing good and hotel was close to some very good shopping areas and to walk the canals from the hotel was a pleasure thumbs up to all the staff there would loved to have spent more time there but had to move on.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: BemjaminHughes
Reviews.Content: Whlst this souds awfully shallow and elitist, I am used to 5-star hotels only. The reason for my staying in this place was that it was booked by others for a stag weekend, hence, I HAD to stay there to stick with the party. I would suggest that no-one stays here ever, as it is dreadful in the extreme. Dire does not justify the extremely poor standards of the hotel - rooms are grotty and have a musty stench. I have a car with more interior space than the bathroom (the car is 2-seater - that's how small the bathroom is) and the staff were as helpful as a chocolate fireguard. Taxi drivers do not seem to know the name or location of the hotel - some ambiguity there. The hotel wasnt even particularly cheap either. The only reasonably positive aspect of the hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls great location”
Reviews.Author: Ranan
Reviews.Content: the location was great, it was quite and very autnentic but still near to the dam squre. the personal was very freindly and efficient. I did not like the noise from the other rooms (and not the one you are thinking of :)) it seems the walls are very thin so every door closer was heard.

Reviews.Title: “1st Trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: spondie
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Amsterdam in January 2007 for myself and 5 friends for 3 nights. I spent many hours looking around the web for a good hotel, finally decided on the Rembrandt Residence for a number of reasons, Location is very good, typical picturesque cannel side location, quite side road, but very near all the sights, dam square 2 min walk away. A few near death experiences with cyclists outside the hotel, but you have to get used to the idea that cyclists rule the roads in Amsterdam! Price was good for Amsterdam but shop around as prices differ hugely for this hotel. I would say this hotel had an excellent location and is one of the hotels biggest assets. We were offered 3 twin rooms all on the ground floor, one next to reception which was a bit noisy in the mornings but nothing too bad. Over eager cleaning staff with Hoovers at 7.30am ! Rooms were very clean and of an average size, no in-room safe was a let down but otherwise each room was equipped with most things needed. (no tea or coffee in room, but only 1.5 euro in the bar). Our Shower curtain leaked like a sieve so we had daily moping up to do on the bathroom floor. Lots of hot water when needed. Smoking is allowed in the reception/bar area and although it did not bother me, some guests found this off putting as it got quite smokey at times and was the first thing to hit you when entering the hotel. Breakfast was a mix of American and traditional Amsterdam fair, as much as you can eat, coffee/tea was always too cold for my taste. Toaster blew up on our 1st day and never came back.. Breakfast room gets quite busy late in the mornings (9.30-10.00am) so get in early. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, although they could not direct me to an internet cafe (Amsterdam has very few Internet cafe's, business opportunity maybe ?) In summary, a very good hotel considering there are so many bad hotels in Amsterdam in this price range. Would defiantly book again in the future and this hotel has a lot to offer for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rembrandt Centrum from June 3-6, 2007. My room was big by Amsterdam standards and clean. For â‚¬99/night, inclusive of taxes, this hotel was a good value. My only complaint is the hotel does not offer in-room safes or mini-bars. The location is good and the area near the hotel is quiet. At â‚¬99 per night, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service”
Reviews.Author: kifera
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen primary for the location, and the location was indeed central. But that's about it. The single room is tiny, windows to the courtyard, practically no sound insulation, so all the sounds of cleaning ladies are loud and clear. The hotel insists on sharp 12 pm check out, but the check out process is terrible, to say the least - the computers freeze, there is obviously a huge bottleneck at the reception and a substantial waiting time. We were waiting for the luggage to be brought from storage for ages - only to realize that the staff in fact speaks neither Dutch, English or German to understand the intstructions of the reception to bring the rest of the bags. Even having paid in advance through the agency, the hotel promptly double charged us on the check-out with subsequent waste of our time to sort it out with the credit card company, the travel agency and the hotel. The hotel was not helpful at all. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waiting for a Refund”
Reviews.Author: pollyvw
Reviews.Content: (Please note...I have never stayed here but I had to enter a date to be able to post this warning) I made a reservation here; cancelled it 2 days later (months before my trip to Amsterdam). Upon returning home, I discovered they have charged my credit card for the room I did not occupy. They have not responded to my email or my snail mail and I am dealing with the CC company for a complete refund. The booking agency has a record that the reservation was cancelled (and I have my personal copy) and a record that they notified the hotel. Hotel email address seems to be 'closed down.' Also, there is a descrepancy about the name of the hotel. I was charged for a room at the Rembrandt RESIDENCE (where I have never made a reservation) and my reservation and cancellation is for the Rembrandt CENTRUM. The hotel's online presence is dual; each has the same street address, phone and fax number. The CCcharge was to the R Residence; the reservation/cancellation for the R Centrum and the email addy the booking agency gave me to contact them was for the R Residence. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - there are better for less Â£”
Reviews.Author: PurpleGirl1
Reviews.Content: It's extremely overpriced for what you get even taking the great location into account. My boyfriend and I were put into a dingy cupboard with the tiny bathroom ceiling in the process of collapsing and no shower rail. We had arrived late, exhausted and couldn't face the hassle of changing, but asked for a change the next day. The staff were not exactly apologetic, but the new room, while basic, was a decent size and had a fabulous view down the canal. I have stayed in various hotels in Amsterdam and this one was the most disappointing. Try the one next door as a tourist office recommended it and it looks great [--] (Hotel Estherea), or see about a deal with the Radisson as we thought that was really good - room 326 has a fab beamed ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but look out for the mice!”
Reviews.Author: jamc204
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good things. First, this hotel has a great location in easy walking distance of good restaurants, historic sites and tram stops. The staff is very friendly and cordial and it's reasonably priced. On the downside, the interior of the hotel has a slightly run down look to it. The halls smell of smoke and the beds are way too squishy. But the biggest problem is with rodents. Yes, there are mice in this hotel. I was there in late March, early April this year with two of my friends. Long story short, they were coming out through a hole in the wall behind a dresser. I suspect that rather than plug the holes in the wall, they just put the dresser in front of it. Whatever the case, I complained to the manager and he acknowleged the problem but didn't have another room to put us in. Instead, he offered me towels which I used to jam between the wall and the cabinet to keep the mouse from entering the room. The mouse didn't like that! He scratched and squealed for about an hour, making it impossible for me to sleep. Finally, he gave up and retreated back into his hole in the wall. Another problem I had was that the underside of my bedcover was sprinkled with nasty unidentified stains. I complained and the staff replaced them, but this should not have happened in the first place. All things considered, it wasn't a bad place but the thought of sleeping among rodents disgusts me and I won't be going again.

Reviews.Title: “great location comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: niadan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June. Great location just a short walk from anywhere really. The staff at the desk were very friendly and provided us with a map and tips for all the local sights. our first room didn't have a shower only a bath as it was on the top floor with low ceilings. We asked to be moved and were dealt with efficiently but had to sacrifice the view for a room with a shower. The room was basic and very dated furniture but clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was nice. There was no real bar in the hotel. If you're looking for a good location and no real luxury then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Top secret on last minute!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: donnerkebab
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as one of lastminute.coms Top secret hotel package. Dont fall for this one its just a con! There is no benefit in booking this way and last minute dont give a stuff once you have booked their customer service is TERRIBLE! The hotel itself was average the staff were very nice and helpful, although their idea of a room with a view is looking into a dingy courtyard. The pay television didnt work and contacting reception required some figuring out as the telephone had the wrong number listed. The room was on the top floor and still had Anne Franks furniture in it. Tiny bath with only a shower attachment in a room with a coombed ceiling made having a shower a challenge. No Hair dryer and no power anywhere near a mirror. Too expensive for whats on offer. N.B if you have a point to raise with Lastminute there is a website with their contact details as they dont give you them.Just google it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: tlmg73
Reviews.Content: Took us a while to find the hotel as Herengracht is rather long and it was a dark rainy night. Tip, for others who can get themselves lost inside a small paper bag, it's located at the Dam sq part of the centre - take one of the horizontals from here past Singel and you should be fine. We booked through last minute and the location was the real reason for the choosing the place. Whilst we didn't have a canal view, we did have a window out into a court yard. Since our room was at ground floor level this made us feel quite secure. The bedroom was a good size, incorporating a kingsize bed, desk, wardrobe and a couple of chairs with ensuite bath/shower room. Slept really well, didn't get any noise from inside the hotel, and even the canal seemed pretty quiet to be honest. the bed was just soooo comfy that I would stay there again anytime! It was nice and warm which gave us the chance to dry out our wet clothes and shoes. The reception staff were always friendly and attentive and happy to stow your luggage until your flight home. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel (extra 12.5 euros) but can say it did smell good! We went out to eat ours at one of the many local cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tjdouglas
Reviews.Content: Had a great four days at the hotel in early January. First night was stuck in a small but adequate room. I went to the desk and asked if I could get a canal view room. The front desk lady said to check in the morning. Morning came and I went down to the front desk where the lady the night before had left a message with the desk people who knew exactly what I wanted and told me to pack my stuff and a canal view room would be ready for me in the afternoon. Returned form a day of sightseeing and was moved into a large beautiful double room on Singal canal. I was very happy, needless to say, with the efficiency of the front desk and the beauty of my view. Throughout my stay the hotel and the staff continued to impress me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: Was in Amsterdam for a short vacation right after New Years. We chose the Rembrandt Residence Hotel based on the availability of a triple room, good location, and above average reviews on TripAdvisor. Location: The location was on Herengracht, one of the 4 original canals of Amsterdam. We could walk to anything, and only used the trams a couple of times. Dam Square and the Jordaan neighborhood were both a 5 minute walk, offering easy access to trams. The Damrak and Central station were approximately 10-15 minutes walking. The Red Light District was about 5 minutes, and about 15 minutes to Leidseplein or the Museum area. Note that the trams are a couple of blocks away, so it might be easiest to take a taxi to/from the Centraal Station if you have a lot of luggage (plus the trams are crowded and are not recommended with lots of luggage anyways). Check-In: Quick and efficient, by friendly personnel with excellent English skills (just like almost everyone else in Holland!). We were given a triple room with 3-beds, as requested. Note that Expedia had a great rate on the hotel, but we booked through the hotel's website and the rates were even better. The Room: The hotel was definitely older, and was in a few different buildings (the buildings in Amsterdam are tall and skinny, so it isn't unusual to have one "hotel" take up several buildings upstairs). Our room was large and spacious, and was a good size for 3 people. It also had a small table which was nice. The bathroom was pretty small though. The room had a pretty low ceiling, and you had to duck a bit to go through the door (I'm 6'2"), but this wasn't a big deal. The worst part was that there were some large beams sticking down from the ceiling, which made the shower rather unpleasant for anyone taller than 5ft! But these were only minor inconveniences. We had a view of the canal, which was great. Unfortunately, the windows seemed pretty thin. This wasn't a big deal except during the mornings when there were workers outside. You could hear practically everything outside, and this was from the top (4th) floor. We were also right next to the housekeeping office and it was very noisy, plus we could hear lots of walking around directly above our room in the mornings (I'm not sure if there is a room up there or what, since we were supposed to be on the top floor, but either way, it was annoying hearing all the footsteps). Amenities: We did not take advantage of the breakfast or other hotel amenities. However, there were several good bakeries near the hotel, one of which gave lots of samples! Check-Out: Quick and Efficient. We opted to take a cab to the Airport because we had 3 people and lots of luggage. The hotel called a cab and it was there within 2 minutes. Conclusion: Despite the minor annoyances with this hotel, I'd probably use it again, especially if I needed a larger triple room. The location is great - right by everything, but on a quiet side street. I loved the Jordaan neighborhood, and it's easily walkable from the hotel. All other major sites can be walked easily, but you're close enough to public transport if you really want it. I'd probably take some ear plugs next time, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMainstay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after christmas for a few days to relax and enjoy Amsterdam. It was a easy walk from Centraal Station and right on the canal which was easy on the eyes even though it was December. The staff was extremely helpful and gave us a map where everything was. The room was nice and very comfortable. Ideal location nothing is more than a 10-15 minute walk and they are very accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: ruthyruth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little noisy with the passing people on the canal but not to the point of keeping us awake because people maybe loud but they move past fairly quickly. The problem was the hotel and it's uncaring staff , with delivery/ collection times at 6.30am -7.15am directly under our window. I know deliveries have to take place, but when they are laughing shouting and having no concern for their residents I find this appalling. We asked for a canal facing room and I had read a few reviews that mentioned passing noise, we can live with that. But this was just total disregard for their paying guests. If you are considering this hotel either ask for a room on the fourth floor or away from the loading bay. Have no other complaints, it was clean ,breakfast ok, apart from having to queue like cattle going to milking to get a seat in the breakfast room (that was because we were late, because so tired from delivery disturbances). If you have booked this hotel contact them by telephone and request room away from loading bay. Ruth Clough Manchester

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anniemed
Reviews.Content: Returned today from Amsterdam. The hotel is perfect for central Amsterdam just 5 minutes from Dam Square. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The room we had was enormous and very clean. We were in a group of 8 (4 rooms) and each one was very clean and spacious. If you haven't been to Amsterdam before, its worth ringing the hotel before travelling and asking them to organise a taxi from the airport. We wasted a good half hour trying to find one when we landed. The only downer is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, so we would say take a travel kettle and a couple of cups with you if you like a cuppa! We would certainly go back to this hotel and recomend it for location cleanliness and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: babsdurrant
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel with my partner for 4 nights and it was awful. We booked a "canal-view".What a joke.The room was a broom cupboard.The double bed was pushed against the wall otherwise we couldn't get into the room.I lost the "flip the coin"to see who sleeps against the wall and had to climb into my side of the bed via the bottom.the windows only opened app 5 cm as the curtain rail was in the way.The bathroom was very smelly,the whole room had a dirty yellow colour and extremely drab.I wouldn't have minded,if we'd booked a cheap hotel,but 397 GBP for 4 nights is not cheap. The reception staff did offer us another room and we moved.It was much bigger,but no canal view ,infact we had a view into other peoples rooms and the reception from which the noise of loud talking,laughing staff was hugely annoying from 7 am til 12 midnight. The excuse we got from the staff to the reason why we couldn't have a room in the new tract with canal view was that we wanted a non-smoking room. I was completely gobsmacked ,that we couldn't have a nice room just because we were non smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: WKTraveler817
